author: {'steamid': '76561197984797898', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 34292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33253, 'last_played': 1609345760}
review:
Très bon TCG .

les devellopeurs sont à l'écoute des joueurs . Ils N'hésistent pas a faire des patch de nerf ou de UP des cartes .
le jeu est trés généreux en matiére de quétes, avoir une bonne collection , vous prendra quelques mois tout en restant gratuit et en jouant quelques heures par semaine .

Les devellopeurs viennent juste de changer les régles du tournois derniérement , ils ont par exemple mis en place un tournois gratuit qui se repetent 6/fois par semaine  pour les débutants où les vieux briscards comme moi ne peuvent pas débarquer .

La RNG est beaucoup plus controlé ici que sur d'autres jeux du même genre , vous n'avez que la RNG lié au tirage des cartes .Ce n'est pas un hearstone like par exemple et loin de là .
Le gameplay du jeu est assez plaisant et facile a comprendre tout en ayant quelques subtilités .le gameplays se rappoche par exemple de Magic the gathering tout en restant plus simple et plus équilibré dans les formes .Il est par exemple beaucoup plus difficile de faire une mana panne dans ce jeu que sur MTG .

Il est possible de jouer contre l'ia . Il y a trois niveaux de difficultés contre l'ia .ET les dévellopeurs renforcent réguiliérement l'ia , ils corrigent ses bugs et crée et mettent place de nouveaux decks pour l'ia notament pour son dernier stade de difficulté . ils ont par exemple mis en place pour l'ia l'a derniérement , un deck deux couleurs meule ( millstone ) , 

Pour tous ceux qui voudraient essayer , je vous conseillerai de prendre le deck dominion au départ ( le violet en couleur ) .IL est beaucoup plus équilibré que les autres decks de départ et il peut se suffire a lui même pour un temps assez large .
Les autres décks de départ et donc couleurs se débloquent tous les 5 niveaux atteints .il y a 5 couleurs en tout qu'il est bien sur possible de mélanger quand vous faites vos propres decks .

author: {'steamid': '76561197961315946', 'num_games_owned': 1091, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 2083, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2053, 'last_played': 1474743885}
review: The timers on ranked matches are to short, about 1 out of 5 matches will be lost or won due to running out of time for one of the players, this is furthered by how complicated the game is at first it seems like a simple magic style clone but once you figure out the rules its actualy a bit more complicated since every creature has a speed and only a creature with a faster speed may block a creature with a slower speed or attack and also back row creatures can not be attacked etc etc etc its quite  a lot to keep track of. I have decided to stop playing it because its a bit hard to walk away from and come back to and also the games just take to long because of all of the complexities.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141295467', 'num_games_owned': 31, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 7592, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4398, 'last_played': 1478109318}
review:
Après avoir joué 40 heures , voici mon constat : C'est une très belle surpise ! 
En fait je cherché un jeu plus "Adulte" que Hearstone mais plus récent que Magic et mon choix c'est porté sur Spellweaver.
De mon point de vue il n'y a ( presque ) que du bien à dire sur ce jeu , les + sont : 

- Des mécaniques de jeu intéréssente ( comme la vitesse , en plus de l'Attaque/Vie , des phases d'attaques/défense bien pensé, les esclaves ... ) 

- L'univers graphique très plaisant ( Les cartes sont très belles , les animations égalements )

- Système de quetes ( Plusieurs quetes sont disponibles et aide grandementt à l'avancé dans le jeu )

- Tournois ! ( grande surpise du jeu , en effet plusieurs Tournois ont lieu dans la semaine et permettent de défier des joueurs pour des prix très alléchant dans une ambiance un peu plus tryhard ) 

- Système de niveau qui récompense le temps passé en jeu. 

Grace aux tournois/Quetes/Récompensse de niveaux l'Obtention de carte reste assez simple , il me semble donc pas néscéssaie de payer pour avancer et profiter plainement du jeu ( il existe également un système de crafting et des Arènes similaire à Hearstone )

Je noterais ce jeu 8,5/10 , pourquoi pas 10/10 ? 

J'enlève 1 point car le Tutoriel est vraiment basique pour des mécanique de jeu qui restent complèxe pour un débutant , ce qui peut vraiment ètre frustrant dans les premières parties ( j'ai seulement joué à Hearstone en TGC ) 

Et le 0,5 restant c'est pour ne pas donner 10 , car meme si le Tutoriel est corrigé , je compte sur l'équipe de spellweaver pour apporter sans cesse de nouvelles améliorations à ce jeu prometteur !

author: {'steamid': '76561198145783166', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 22446, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15537, 'last_played': 1641777947}
review:
As good as MTG in my humble opinion, and i played the actual MTG card game back in the day! I love building decks in this game, there are so many different angles to approach from, especially with the new cards that were added in the last patch!

The devs seem pretty on top of it, there were some balancing issues a while back that removed some OP abilities and tamed others (RIP my Elf Commander deck /cry), and overall the new balance seems better. I still get my ass handed to me on a regular basis in friendly games, but i've managed to build a few decks that win more often than not, which is satisfying.

I do wish the pricing were a bit better on crystals and the "buy in" levels they have available. But as it stands, i have built a respectable library of cards just by completing the quests that pop up when you log in, and "crafting" new cards with extras i get from the packs.

For a free game, i highly recommend it to folks who enjoy CCGs. I would probably have paid upwards of $20 for this, even better that it's free!

author: {'steamid': '76561198137798765', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2927, 'last_played': 1578026471}
review:
ccg를 좋아한다면 해볼만한 게임이다.

 일단 다른 평가에서 언급한 스피드 시스템부터 시작해서 카드 하나하나의 효과 역시 참신하고 재미있다. 물론 일부 op라고 생각이 드는 효과들도 있고 시스템이 좀 복잡한 편이다. 그러나 카드게임을 좀 해본 경력이 있다면 금방 적응하고 재미있게 즐길 수 있다. (효과가 더럽게 다양해서 영어의 압박은 좀 심하다.)

 아무리 재미있다고 해도 판타지 마스터즈처럼 한정판 카드를 마구 찍어내고 돈을 수백,수천만원을 써야 한다면 의지가 꺾인다. 그러나 이 게임에는 한정판 카드따위 없으며 게임 내 퀘스트 보상이 매우 혜자스럽다. 하스스톤으로 치면 전설등급의 카드를 퀘스트 보상으로 그냥 주거나 카드가 10장 들어있는 팩을 2개씩 주기도 한다.
 거기다가 12만원정도 주고 6개월 패키지를 끊으면 비싸기는 해도 무려 1680장의 카드를 6개월에 걸쳐서 받을 수 있다. 패키지로 받는 카드는 중복이 안나오기 때문에 패키지 끊고 퀘스트를 꾸준히 깨주면 카드는 금방 모인다. 또 하스스톤처럼 카드를 갈아서 다른 카드를 만들 수 있고 오픈한지 얼마 안되서 카드 종류도 아직 많지 않으므로 카드를 모으기 매우 쉽다.

  그렇다고 노현질로 하는 것을 추천하진 않는다. 하스스톤의 경우 같은 카드를 2장씩만, 그리고 전설은 1장씩만 사용이 가능하고 유희왕의 경우 기본은 3장이나 준제한, 제한, 금지 등으로 사기카드를 규제한다.

 그런데 이 게임은 모든 카드가 다 덱에 4장 들어간다. 전설이라고 쓰여진 카드는 필드 위에 오직1장만 존재한다는 규칙이 있기는 한데 그래도 덱에는 4장까지 들어간다. 그렇다 보니 좋은 카드는 다 3~4장씩 들어가고 초보자들은 그저 눈물만 난다. 나는 한장도 없는 카드를 상대는 쓰고 또 쓰고 무덤에서 살리고 하니 버틸 수가 없다. 유저 수가 적어서 초보자끼리 매칭되지도 않는다. 그냥 패키지 정도는 질러주자. 그래야 대전 퀘스트라도 좀 깰 수 있다.

게임 모드는 컴퓨터와 하는 매치, 일반게임과 랭크게임, 트라이얼(하스스톤의 투기장, 랜덤한 카드를 골라서 게임한다.) 정도가 있다. 이외에도 현금걸고 하는 대회나 크고 작은 대회도 열린다. ccg가 고픈 유저라면 영어의 압박따윈 무시하고 꼭 해보도록 하자.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045478794', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 422, 'last_played': 1474244318}
review:
To be fair, I've only logged 5 hours of gameplay, so a lot is still to be discovered about the game.  I'm writing a review to state that the game is quite literally a Magic The Gathering clone with a few different twists.  I mean a literal clone.  It has "aspects" which mirror the magic mana colors, red goblins and fire, dark ghouls and undead, white knights & angels, green nature & elves.. first strike, sacrificing creatures and enchantments, activated abilities, instant speed spells, etc.. Almost everything is IDENTICAL to magic.  I'm still giving the game a chance, and will play it for a bit, but for me personally I am disappointed that it is such a copy of MTG, with very little originality.

The few differences do make it a bit interesting.  I really like the "speed" of the creatures, and the combat choices of whether to attack creatures or the character are a nice feature for me.  The combat in general gives you A LOT more to think about.  My biggest issue with MTG is getting "mana screwed" and although you still draw mana as cards in this game, it's handled differently, and is far less painful - your "shrines" aka lands, actually draw you cards.

If you're familiar with MTG, it's easy to get going after playing a few very basic tutorials explaining the unfamiliar features.  If you're not familiar with MTG I think it may be very difficult to grasp the game, as the tutorials don't explain very much of the intricate mechanics.

In summary, if you are interested in a MTG clone with a few tweaks to make it interesting, then you may love this game.  If you are looking for a fresh and original game to play, as I was, you may be disappointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198290434024', 'num_games_owned': 206, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 1978, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1697, 'last_played': 1527200037}
review:
总体来说是一款很不错的游戏，奖励非常丰厚，新手可以找老玩家推荐拿好几万的金币。开荒大概在11级到13级就能完全结束，之后每天的任务、还有几天一刷的学院任务，都非常棒，真真正正的免费卡牌游戏，无需投钱，也可能是现在卡池还很浅的缘故吧。

游戏的规则不同于炉石，在玩家进攻时，防守方还能做出有效的布置，因此并不是一个进攻绝对主导的游戏。无脑铺场是没有效果的，虽然去除法术不是特别强力，但是能铺场的生物一般速度比较慢、血量也非常感人。

总的来说亮点在于：[b]1. 防守回合反击； 2. 生物的速度属性； 3. 支援线这个概念，以及一些支援线上的combo卡牌。[/b]当然了，这样的机制也使得它比炉石复杂很多，因而在推广上也无法与之相比吧（何况炉石还占了魔兽这个ip的便宜）。

一句话，是一款上手中速、上手后能让玩家沉浸的卡牌游戏。

author: {'steamid': '76561198047229085', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5635, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2901, 'last_played': 1603339177}
review:
Eu procurei muito tempo um CCG que me deixasse satisfeito, e vou explicar porque Spellweaver conseguiu (e como ele poderia ter conseguido mais):

- Variedade de mecânicas: esse é o core do que faz um jogo de carta bom. Ter uma vasta gama de de abordagens para vencer o jogo e, ainda mais vastas, formas de se personalizar essas estratégias, colocando aquelas cartas que só você usa.

- Qualidade de mecânicas: Elas podem ser simples, complexas; ao redor de uma carta com poder escífico ou de várias cartas com intenções parecidas; boas/efetivas ou impráticas/divertidíssimas. Afinal, o design do jogo foi feito por um mestre de Magic: The Gathering, que sabe muito bem como nos sentimos quando batemos o olho naquela estratégia que nos dá vontade de gastar tempo/dinheiro pra conseguir executar.

- Design dos recursos: Esse deve ter sido o maior foco de "como eu vou melhorar o Magic?" E é muito, MUITO, bem pensando. Você nunca vaise sentir trollado pelo seu deck se você montar ele com uma quantidade minimamente razoável de mana. O jogo sabe que sua diversão é montar estratégias com magias, criaturas e artefatos, e não ficar pensando se você deveria colocar mais 2 terrenos verdes ou 1 verde e um azul no seu deck tricolor. A geração de mana quase nunca entra no seu caminho, e ela também não e imbecil e garantida com em Hearthstone.

- Dá pra jogar de graça mesmo?: Sim, eu jogo a pouco tempo (maior parte das minhas horas é jogo aberto no pc enquanto eu durmo) e detenho 4 decks que eu gosto. Fazer as quests diárias contra a IA (vitória mais garantida) ou participar das Trials e quests de PvP. Tudoisso dámuita carta/booster. Bem como os prêmios de passagem de nível e o sistema de crafting (que te dá uma quantidade muito boa de Commons e Uncommons, mas está longe da minha realidade usar ele para cartas de raridades maiores).

- Torneios o tempo todo: se você curte isso, tem mil torneios por dia, com prêmios. Enlouqueça, pq eu não curto muito.

- O que tem pra melhorar?:
  - No momento, o jogo é mouse only. Apesar da comunidade estar falando sobre atalhos de teclado a um tempo.
  - Continuar expandindo é importante, isso tem acontecido e espero que continue! Bom trabalho!
  - Talvez um dia rolar a conversão para True TCG, porque ainda não rola de trocar carta. Mas acredito que isso matou o Scrolls, da Mojang, pois não entrava dinheiro com boosters. Minha dicaé, fazer isso depois de atingir um sucesso considerável.
  - O deck azul precisa ser mais desagradável, por favor, é a tradição.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052944730', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 20276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9064, 'last_played': 1619433139}
review:
This is a good game if you look into a more in-depth TCG. I started with Hearthstone, but wanted to try something a little more advanced, tried this and loved it. This game is not as beginner friendly as Hearthstone, but has much deeper mechanics and deckbuilding possibilities. I also think it is more balanced. (Every card is viable in the right deck; not at all the case in Hearthstone).
My personal rating would be:
-F2P model: 10 / 10  I play completely free to play and own almoust all cards I want. You can ofc buy boosterpacks for real money, but you never have to or feel the need that you must.
-balance: 8 / 10 The devs keep a close eye on the game and change cards very quick if they are unhealthy.
-difficulty/beginner friendliness: 5 / 10 Not an easy game to learn, but once you are in it it is fun.
-card effects: 8/10 Most of the cards have interesting effects that synergize with other cards, yet there are not to many cards with really extreme/ spectacular powers.
- deckbuilding: 8/10 Every card can be viable and due to so many card interactions (and no class restriction in deckbuilding like in Hearthstone), there are almoust endless possibilities.
-presentation: 4.5 / 10   It serves, but not at all as polished as Hearthstone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040957910', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 2543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1507, 'last_played': 1608915091}
review:
At the time of review I have only F2P'ed the game.

I find this game to be a lot of fun. It has much more strategic depth than Hearthstone (and much less RNG), while fixing mana starvation issues of MTG. As someone who only played Hearthstone for a couple months (and Magic for a couple of games), I thought it would be intimidating to jump into a new CCG. But it's been an approachable experience so far. I've unlocked 3 factions just by leveling up, and I am enjoying the deck-building mechanic with 2-colour cards. 

Other people have raised concerns about the F2P no longer being very generous, and the player base being smaller than major CCGs. I can't comment on these issues since I only play it casually. I do get short wait times on matchups, so I'm not complaining. 

In the end, it's F2P with fun mechanics and loads of deck-building possibilities (at least at my noob level). If you like card games (even just casual ones like Hearthstone), do give this a shot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011211496', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 23142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6769, 'last_played': 1704155279}
review:
Realmente me encanta este juego. Lo primero que llamo mi atención fue el sistema de combate, el añadir el valor de "velocidad" a las cartas para poder saber si pueden ser bloqueadas o no le da un giro muy profundo a la mecánica de combate. 

El sistema de gestión de recursos a primera vista puede parecer un tanto antiguo, pero en verdad es muy interesante. Las probabilidades de que te quedes sin recursos para jugar son minimas, sin embargo añaden otra capa de decisiones que el jugador puede tomar por turno para gestionar de la forma mas conveniente sus cartas. Decidir si aumnetar un nivel o robar una carta en determindados momentos puede ser decisivo para la partida.

Asi mismo el sistema de poder de héroes que puede ser modificado por las cartas de recursos durante la partida también agrega otra decisión que es muy interesante, ya que no sólo debes decidir que poderes tendrás durante el juego, pero también el momento oportuno.

Además puedes interactuar con "hechizos instantáneos" durante el combate y al final del turno de tu rival, el de los primeros JCC digitales donde lo he visto implementado, y funciona a la perfección, añade interacción sin sacrificar ritmo en la partida.

Como algo negativo puedo decir que la curva de aprendizaje (especialmente la construcción de mazo) es un poco elevada, por lo menos en mi caso, tarde en entender cuales eran las cartas mas "poderosas" de un mismo turno. Por ejemplo, una carta de 2 niveles y costo 1, o una carta de 1 nivel y costo 2. Esto es un poco confuso especialmente si intentas entenderlo como a MTG (a mi me pasó), por lo que es mejor acercarse a este juego con la idea de que es algo muy diferente.

Con respecto al arte de las cartas, hay algunas cartas cuyas ilustraciones no son tan buenas técnicamente, pero hay otras que son muy bellas, pero entiendo que es un juego que va comenzando y estoy seguro que eso mejorará. Para finalizar debo decir que la estetica general del juego no me gusta mucho (es un tipo de fantasía de los años 80), pero eso es algo muy personal que no evita que disfrute el juego.

Todo lo anterior aunado con el hecho de que los desarrolladores estan muy al pendiente del meta, constantemente corrigiendo errores y aprendiendo de su juego (son un estudio pequeño y un juego nuevo, es comprensible que haya errores) hace de este juego una opción muy buena para cualquier amantante de los juegos de estrategia.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015021952', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 22912, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13114, 'last_played': 1608895118}
review:
At the moment the best card game on the market in my opinion - out of those I checked while trying to scratch the MtG itch (this includes Elder Scrolls: Legends which went into open beta a couple of weeks ago). Its main strength is that a few fairly unique features (e.g. creature speed, support + front line, cards' cost split into mana and aspect level) give the game nice strategic/tactical depth and simply make it a lot of fun.
Other pluses:
- nice community
- developers are very responsive (and take active participation in community)
- the true free-to-play model (which makes me spend some money on the game every month just out of gratitude).
It's been my go-to game for relaxing after work for a few months now. Recommended! :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198008907767', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 11856, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5612, 'last_played': 1481302691}
review:
Nonostante a prima vista sembri un normalissimo gioco di carte f2p come tanti altri, ho apprezzato molto il fatto che si sforzi di essere un vero free to play, a differenza di molti altri: si può come sempre pagare per avere carte e pacchetti più in fretta, ma ogni giorno verranno date missioni con ricompense generose e questo permette a chiunque di ottenere carte, anche molto rare, in tempi relativamente brevi, a differenza del solito. 
E' possibile trovare qualunque carta nei pacchetti normali ("normal pack"), compresi gli eroi e le carte leggendarie- 

i livelli di rarità sono comune, non comune, rara, leggendaria , eroica-

e ottenere carte leggendarie o eroiche non è affatto improbabile - io per esempio in un mese e mezzo di gioco ho ottenuto 3 eroi non base (su 12)-quelli base ti vengono dati praticamente subito- e alcune decine di carte leggendarie.

Come gioco è valido, non troppo complicato ma nemmeno semplicissimo- a differenza di magic per esempio è difficile che capiti di usare carte nel turno avversario- la grafica è buona e i suoni sono discreti. Vengono inoltre spesso proposti tornei tra i giocatori. 

In definitiva, sebbene non tocchi livelli di complicatezza strategica alla magic: the gathering è comunque un ottimo gioco di carte che, soprattutto, permette a tutti di giocare senza spendere soldi anche a livelli elevatissimi e senza dover giocare decine e decine di ore per ottenere quattro soldi con cui comprare un pacchetto con una fatica enorme. La conseguenza è che dopo non più di un mese sarete già in grado di giocare con mazzi molto forti senza aver speso nulla, se volete. Hanno da poco rilasciato la prima espansione, che si è rivelata molto valida e consiglio caldamente di provare il gioco.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054827496', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 43227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35040, 'last_played': 1485165903}
review:
Well the game is really interesting if you ever played and are a fan of any ccg or tcg games. I got into this game once a friend showed me a deal with this game where you would get shamans deck for free. From then i started playing, and at first the game progress quite quickly, you get lots of gold and can unlock the first basic heroes. My advice to anyone playing try and do as much quests as possible and try to unlock all the basic heroes and their place on the map as this way u will get heroes quicker and can get more quests to get more gold. Also while opening the packs you shouldnt be getting same basic heroes from it and will get some other cards instead. Even though further game starts to get more and more the same and you need to do some grinding if you are not p2w player. 

This game has great tactical depth, nice card arts, varied meta game, and all in all is very well balanced game. Also it is very generous with its rewards, and how much htings they give to u for free or just by playing the game. So if u dont rush u can get everything via just playing the game and dont need to spend a dime. There are various different tournaments daily, also there is monthly grand tournament called masters which gives real money to you if you do good in it. In the past it was 2k$ prize pool, but now recently it dropped to 250$ guaranteed prize pool but it can increase by the amount other players donate to it. There are six different aspects in the game all having its own strengths and weaknesses :)

Also after the recent expansion pack and changes in the crafting mechanism for new cards, and added new heroic rarity level for cards it became harder to finish all the collection, and the achievements you can get in game are now much harder to reach.

All in all its still quite good game, with a decent balance between cards and very nice game mechanics. So I would still recommend this game to others.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080765044', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 11325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9373, 'last_played': 1688822193}
review:
说到问题的话，服务器不怎么好容易掉线，UI也一般点击感不太好，还有坑爹的汉化，妈的汉化团队食屎去吧，google机翻的水平。

除此之外我要盛赞这个游戏，设计的很用心，各种技能的操作感非常好。游戏采用的是有限制的响应机制，可以在敌方回合使用瞬间和大部分卡牌异能。游戏还引入了科技和速度的概念，真要说起来似乎比万智还要复杂那么一丢丢，但是相当好玩。

氪金方面还行，我氪了1000不到几乎全卡，据说不氪金也能玩的很开心，就是你大概要玩上一段时间的rush。比较常见的套路大概是rush，中速控，大哥套，还有奥义。这游戏除了打死对面还可以奶自己到40血自动获胜，所以还有各种奶套（奥义或大哥）。

总之非常好玩，建议尝试下。

author: {'steamid': '76561198035917350', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 106399, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64607, 'last_played': 1650510070}
review:
Pros

-Beautiful presentation and excellent card designs, the game has a relaxing atmosphere and is a pleasure to play because of this. Small improvements could still be made to the board and ui and display options, such as an improved sorting system for the graveyard.

-Sophisticated Combat system, best in card game industry, ability for creatures to block, combat tricks, speed, mana and draw management system is top notch great decision making.

-Multiple Heroes and Powers with ability to have up to 3. Which is nice. But the Heroes themselves cannot fight which sucks. 

-You can earn xp and progress in the game against the ai, so you aren't forced to play pvp like other card games to earn rewards and more cards for your collection, this gives the player so much more flexibility in how they enjoy the game, not being forced to do something is huge for someone like me, so if you like that choice, it is possible despite very grindy and demanding of your time.

-So much flexibility to your deck building with ability to mix class cards in decks, more deck possibilities than popular card games by far. Great for creative deck building and experimentation.

-Developing of game came to a halt as did the Master updates, so the game is in poor shape these days. Needs to be opened up for modding and offnline mode to live on in hands of the fans of what it could have been.

- Numerous Diverse quests with satisfying rewards from new card packs and in game currency (gold) to help you develop your card collection to pve quests that reward you for beating particular ai content adding to the gameplay diversity. Could have so much more, a campaign was released, but was too little too late.

-Ability to play friends and get xp from those matches, other card games don't allow rewards for matches between friends, and this gives Spellweaver the upper hand, as people like to play their friends for fun and not feel like they shouldn't because they wouldn't be rewarded for it.

- three different levels of difficulty vs the ai so you can play at your level, this is huge. Hoping for more in the future here.

-because of the ai flexibility and reward, you aren't forced into pvp against people who may have bigger card collections than you. This takes out the huge issue of matchmaking problems of other card games and is a huge upside in Spellweaver, when you are ready to compete with people then you can, but you aren't forced to as the only way to progress in the game. This is getting harder and harder to do though as the gap widens between active players and casual or new players.

-the game does not punish you for not doing daily quests, because you can simply play the ai at your own pace and level and when you have time to play.

-No restricting limit on how many pre made decks you want to have in your Library, this is massive complaint in other card games, where their developers refuse to increase the deck slots, that is simply not an issue in Spellweaver, you have plenty of deck slots and never worry about it. Absolute pleasure.

-The Tournaments and masters scene is dead, as is pvp, only chance of this game living on now is in the hands of fans and by opening it up to offline play and modding and leave it in the hands of the fans left over.

-Spectate feature, so you can watch in games with friends if you into that.

- The card collecting is fun and when you get a card you don't have with a fun mechanic you get very excited to create a new deck around it to feature that new mechanic and play with it. Such as Dreyla, what an amazing card before they nerf killed it, now it is a very boring card with same powers as other cards, very repetitive and unoriginal unlike before. Hopefully they fix it.

-A game you can play for 30mins when you don't know what else to play, and it always delivers.


Cons:

- can't choose cards to keep and throw back in opening hand, which is not a great way to do card games.

- The new rarity created has increased costs significantly, so more grind. Or more pay. And Heroes also got increased to that rarity. But luckily they made the heroes easier to access now freely during levelling because it just made no sense that they had made them more expensive and behind a pay wall. So things have smoothed over on the hero front. Which isn't as bad as before. But it still tricks people who don't know they get them freely from levelling and then they spend money or gold on them and find out later they didn't have to. 

- Their Discord is like North Korea dictatorship against free speech, avoid it like the plague

- Aggro and Rush decks can at times dominate Spellweaver and detract from the strengths of Spellweaver, that involve back and forth competitive matches.

- Some really great cards have been destroyed in the name of balance, but it wasn't balance, it was just destruction of a mechanic because some players with too much influence and money pushed their way, and pushed the game in the wrong direction.


- Starting Aspect/Faction used to be a choice, now you are forced into one with no choice. That faction might be your least favourite, but it doesn’t matter, they decided that everyone should start with that. Terrible idea. If I was a new player now, I would hate this very much. The problem with this is that some people quit based solely on playing that one starting Aspect. Had they tried another, they may have liked the game.

- New players that want to compete pvp, will face a decision of either grind vs ai first or pay. The game is generous and balanced, that you could have a decent deck early on. But it gets boring playing always the same deck. So you want to grow your collection for more variety asap. If the costs of getting a large collection quickly weren't so high, it wouldn't be so bad to invest into the game.

- Like most free to play games, there is an underlying dissatisfaction and lack of access to content immediately if you don't pay, and the pay wall is rather steep in comparison to other games in the market the cost of this game is ludicrous if you were to pay for the cards. But you can grind it all out in time like I have. Hundreds of hours. Worth it in the end and more satisfying. Some other free games out there you can't get all the cards after hundreds of hours or ever, you have to pay. So it kind of makes Spellweaver still better in that regard.

-Would be great if friendly matches between friends outside of the queue counted towards quests, but they don't.


Bottom Line:

SpellWeaver could have some of the finest card combat balance and gameplay. I have hundreds of hours with just the ai matches. This game could have zero people playing it, and it would still be playable and highly enjoyable with plenty of replay-ability. The way this game engages the brain is very satisfying. Truly an intellectuals game.

But just delete and censor all your discussions they don't like despite them being allowed to say whatever they want to you and about you. author: {'steamid': '76561198016032353', 'num_games_owned': 151, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2954, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1743, 'last_played': 1618932044}
review: I play Spellweaver since the release in January (first from the site and recently from Steam) and find the game fascinating! I come from Hearthstone and it was a bit hard to start in the beginning, especially compared to Hearthstone, but that improved after the release of several updates and currently if you play for some time, you start to get familiar with the cards and the fun begins! The game is much more predictable than Hearthstone in the meaning of skills (you can't just get killed by having full health and on an empty board by meeting some mega-deadly-super-combo coming from your opponent o.O ). Another very fun thing is that there are much more deck archetypes that come to be competitive (e.g. "mill deck" is something that is available in HS, but I have the feeling that they have added it only to be available ... you cannot climb ladder with it, you cannot go to tournament with it ... the moment your opponent finds out that you are playing mill, and you are almost dead!). That makes Spellweaver much more diverse in styles of play. And when I said tournaments, the game has tournament system integrated, so when you want to play in a competition, the whole thing happens in the game and this way everything (rules, results of the games, etc. ) is much more clear and predictable. Maybe I should say few words about the art as well - all the cards are with unique atmosphere distinctive and unique for the game, with its own universe and epic story. The artists have shown brilliant skills and creativity in drawing every single card. Also the prices of the cards and decks are better than Hearthstone and the only thing that might confuse new players a bit is that there is greater chance to play against very skilled opponent! (I am not at a very high rank, but the system matched me against the current champion of the ladder :) ) I guess the reason is that there aren't so many players in play (I believe they are probably several thousand considering the ladder ... ) - compared to the 30 million players in HS, if the game really has to match you against someone at your level, you would have to wait more for a game, which I would find annoying. And besides ... what's bad playing against the champion? :) There are also several sites that discuss the best decks of the current meta and give you ideas for building your own ... just write "spellweaver decks" in google and several will come. Some of the top players broadcast on youtube and you can hear very interesting stuff from there ... some of them are coming from games like MTG and are very skilled and competent players from which you can learn a lot about this type of games!  Overall I find the game very well balanced, allowing you to play in very different styles and for an indie game I can say that it totally rocks!

author: {'steamid': '76561198013027024', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 9841, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8656, 'last_played': 1475352772}
review: I'm a grandpa gamer. First experiance with CCGs/TCGs was with a retail MTG starter box when it exploded into gamer's awareness. Spellweaver is a more involved take on the genre, It's been likened to Hearthstone but MTG is the more apt comparison. I find all the factions to be fairly balanced. Finding a game is pretty easy and the AI provides a challenge even at easy difficulty, not to mention extreme or harder. There are daily challenges and frequent tournaments with fair rewards. Perhaps best of all its free to play. I've logged over a hundred hours so far and have had fun and been rewarded for each one. I fully recommend anyone who likes card games to give Spellweaver a try!

author: {'steamid': '76561198097244472', 'num_games_owned': 84, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 4241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1155, 'last_played': 1583417091}
review:
介于万智牌和炉石之间，比炉石的话竞技向居多，比万智牌简单很多，顺便新手卡组非常友好（黑色新手卡组强·无敌），另外这个我记得没错的话，是万智牌外第一个出中文版的这类卡牌游戏。
缺点的话，国内玩的话偶尔会掉线，但是会很快的重连，卡牌类游戏的话，这点重连时间也不是等不了，然后是竞技场，比较觉得不友好的是，竞技场不打，直接放弃是没有奖励。

author: {'steamid': '76561198085356314', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 437, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 437, 'last_played': 1471832506}
review:
这游戏的界面类似冠军对决，系统又有万智牌的地和战斗阶段，攻击可以选生物又像炉石，简直是个大杂烩。
目前说白了没什么平衡而言，简单的来说说我的开荒之旅。
游戏因英雄不同起手的费率和专精点差异巨大，新手英雄1费起0精专，传奇英雄2、3费起精专各不相同。
传奇英雄起手下3费大哥，你还在犹豫1费铺地2费怎么解大哥，抱歉对面要4费了。
开始系统默认强制让你用生命系新手套，你没法选择别的,最根本的问题是这套卡起手根本没有强解。
现在7级了，才完成了所谓初心者的任务，在竞技模式赢一局。
不要奇怪为什么都7级才赢了一局，因为我在竞技模式从开没有遇到和我一样的新手生命系卡组。
不知道是不是新人都被这游戏的平衡性吓跑了，我侥幸赢的一局还是对面极限卡地我险胜的。

我觉得你们在鼓励玩家买包的同时先考虑下游戏的平衡性，如果连基本的竞技乐趣都没有，为什么要花钱开包。

author: {'steamid': '76561197973047319', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 2014497, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 15705, 'playtime_at_review': 50750, 'last_played': 1712454853}
review:
The main thing I'd like to say: I think this is a great game and I give it a strong recommendation.

So, now to the reasons.

It is really free to play. The game is very generous with rewards and you'll get all the cards for free as you play.

The game has good creativity, and well-designed cards with a lot of variety for gameplay.

Downsides IMO:

- There is a ramp-up where you will be in some trouble playing players who have played longer. But the AI option helps with that.

- Your options don't seem really that broad when it comes to playing better players. There seem to be narrower choices for decks that are 'competitive'.

- The community is mixed. Some nice people and some who prefer to insult and be obnoxious.

I think this is a gem that's not well known and deserves the support of players.

They might need to think of ways to make more money though, not sure how that's going.

Update: after thousands of games, a few imbalances are starting to grate. Especially with the purple, making the game less fun.

Some of the new mechanics encourage 'gimmick decks' which need their own counters, trying to play for all these things in a lmited deck is an issue.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040928186', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 13141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11038, 'last_played': 1473023807}
review:
Excellent jeu de cartes à collectionner, avec des mécaniques bien rodées tout en étant simples à appréhender. L'aspect f2p est très honnête, et les quêtes sont généreuses. De plus, les développeurs sont très attentifs à leur jeu, il est aimé par ses concepteurs, et cela se sent ! Ces derniers tâchent de faire évoluer leur jeu, soignent la méta quand elle dégénère, et demandent (en prenant en compte) l’avis de leurs joueurs.

L'aspect graphique peut sembler "kitsch", mais est en réalité très bien conçu. Certains designs sont excellents, d'autres plus classiques, il y en a pour tous les goûts.

Léger bémol, le système de craft peut être rébarbatif pour les plus impatients (le taux de conversion des cartes est à hauteur de 1/5), néanmoins, rien d'impossible, si l'on accepte de jouer ce que l’on a dans sa collection, ou de faire des trials (les « arènes »).

Il est dur d'exister parmi la horde de jeux de cartes contemporains, néanmoins, Spellweaver arrive à se démarquer !

author: {'steamid': '76561198065664411', 'num_games_owned': 36, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 34664, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18351, 'last_played': 1650174099}
review:
스펠위버의 전투 방식은 독특하다. 공격자가 공격 대상을 직접 지정한다는 점에선 하스스톤과 유사하다. 하지만 방어자 역시 공격하는 적 카드에 방어 카드를 직접 지정한다는 점은 매직 더 게더링과 유사하다. 즉 하스스톤과 매직 더 게더링의 특징을 모두 살렸다. 공격자가 공격 대상을 직접 선택하는 방식, 그리고 방어자가 무엇으로 방어할 것인지를 직접 선택하는 방식, 이 두 방식을 어떻게 동시에 살릴 수 있었을까? 스펠위버는 Speed(속도)라는 고유의 스탯을 카드에 추가했다. 즉 다른 CCG들과 다르게 스펠위버의 카드는 공격력과 생명력뿐만 아니라 속도까지, 총 3개의 스탯을 가지고 있다. 속도가 느린 카드는 빠른 카드를 공격할 수도, 그 카드의 공격을 방어할 수도 없지만, 그 대신 상대적으로 높은 공격력과 생명력을 가지고 있다. 속도가 느린 상대방 카드가 내 명치를 치려고 하면 속도가 빠른 내 카드로 방어할 순 있지만, 그만큼 공격력과 생명력이 낮으므로 주의해야 한다. 이렇게 새로운 스탯을 추가함으로써 스펠위버는 자신만의 독특한 전투 방식을 만들어낼 수 있었다.
 스펠위버는 대회 중심으로 게임을 운영해서 커뮤니티를 활성화하고 있다. 가령 정기적으로 열리는 대회의 상금을 크라우드 펀딩을 통해 늘림으로써 유저들에게 참가 동기를 부여하려는 의도가 보인다. 게다가 더 작은 대회도 날마다, 언제나 열리고 있다. 또한 ELO 기반의 레이팅이 명시된 순위표도 인게임에서 즉시 볼 수 있는데, 이는 유저들에게 더욱 큰 경쟁심을 준다. 아이디 옆에 유저들의 국가를 표시됨으로써 어느 국가 유저들이 게임을 제일 잘 하는지 엿볼 수 있게 해놓은 것은 덤이다. 하스스톤과는 조금 다른 스타일의, 좀 더 심오하고 덜 캐주얼한 CCG를 하고 싶은 사람들에게 추천한다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022311798', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 11870, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6264, 'last_played': 1650096075}
review:
Spellweaver is probably the best digital CCG right now on the market. I'm saying this after playing countless hours and ranked wins in Heartstone, having played runescape chronicles and a few others.

What this game beats both, is the generous reward system(you can easily build a top tier competitive deck in about a week or two, just by doing quests and participating in the newbie tournaments), fun mechanics, countless decks that are competitive(unlike heartstone and chronicles, you can combine colors here, like in magic), while more or less maintaining the relative balance in the game. Of course there's still work to do, but you won't have 90% warrior in ranked, and a trash priest here. In fact, you rarely encounter the same deck twice. There are also tournaments besides the usual ranked and trial-draft mode, in which you can participate for increasing rewards for every win with your contructed decks.

Overall I can only recommend this game, since the developers actually seem to care about their game, they care about delivering a good experience to the players who put their time and/or money into the game, putting in balance patches and improving the content regularly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093037860', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2855, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2851, 'last_played': 1660603872}
review:
Very balanced, with a good learning curve and nicely made tutorials to get you right into the game, alowing you to have some pve missions to get into the rythm of your deck. Nice duel matching system - never opposed someone far better or worse then me.Although it is free to play its not the common "pay to win" - skill and practice actually DO matter and you can make pretty strong deck even with small resourses. The servers are exelent - never had dced even once, fast loading... And the card drawing, they are awesome! The only think needs to be done imho is weakening a bit couple of blue cards, but still, i have to say i hate blue control decks:P.
Anyways, great game, keep the good work!

author: {'steamid': '76561198214360980', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 212075, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20589, 'last_played': 1675072491}
review:
As a former professional card game player, Spellweaver is by far the best and most challenging CCG/TCG out there I've tried.  I see it as an improved version of the world class MTG.  
Gameplay is very good and strategically deep, with a large variety of mechanics to play around with.  The hero cards add depth to deck-building and having 6 'colors/factions' opens many possibilities.
The learning curve is a bit high for complete beginners who have never played this kind of games before, but the Devs are improving the new player experience with better tutorials and aid for the beginning players.
Above all, I must sincerely congratulate the Spellweaver Team.  They are active and responsive all the time, listen to the community, admit openly when they have failed or gone wrong, patch when needed, and very generous!  Kudos!  I have never seen such commitment from any other game, in over 20 years of gaming... With a larger player base, Spellweaver will become a long lasting gem in the world of card games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036926974', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 24015, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18857, 'last_played': 1514012621}
review:
Sorry for my English;)
The game is gorgeous. The gameplay is quiet similar to the MTG, aesthetics are nice and calm. The main advantage relatively to other digital TCG is a much more generous system of rewards. Here you get three daily quests, you can stack up to six, and do them simultaneously. In addition, every three days, game provides additional epic quest with higher awards. During the game against bots and against the people awarded gold and experience. Moreover, the defeat on Ladder and Friendly award only twice in less than a victory. This greatly helps to relax and not be tied to the outcome of the match, and just playing for pleasure.
As a result, the collection grows very quickly. If we talk about the prices, they are about six times lower than in HS and games with a similar pricing policy.

review:
I've been playing for about 4-6 months now, and I've got to say, this is a blast!

Not a clone, just a very well executed game with great mechanics and a variety of cards and strategies to choose from.

If I have any constructive criticism for the game, it would be that we're really missing more in the way of PVE content

i.e. Dungeon instances that you can enter/run once every 2-4 hours that give gold/card rewards - thinking of the old MTG / Shandalar where you could enter a dungeon area and to move around you had to play a card game against a monster in the way.  Since you don't have a character to move around, just make it a PVE instance progression bar, make it pretty, and final boss has a chance to drop a card pack or some such.

Food for thought!

Question: is there any plan for an auction house and/or co-op play? I feel so alone in there! :P

author: {'steamid': '76561198281927500', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 476, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 476, 'last_played': 1460928254}
review:
Spellweaver is a game that will appeal greatly to Magic the Gathering fans who find Heartstone a little simplistic. Those of you who have tried to play Magic on a computer and discovered how clumsy its rules are in online play, will appreciate this game.
Spellweaver keeps the key elements which I like about Magic, but simplifies those things that don't work well. You still have lands, but the problem with mana screw is solved. You still have instants, just not thousands of chances to play them each turn.
The creature combat has more depth compared with the combat in Magic, not to mention Heartstone.
The quality of the card art is stunning, the cards themselves are well designed.  The game is also rather generous - you can play and be competitive without feeling much pressure to pay.

Give Spellweaver a try, you will like it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992961586', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1473248550}
review:
Please, ignore my playtime, I've played a lot more on the non-Steam version.

An excellent trading-card game for fans of Magic the Gathering that want something with a little more depth and complexity. Feels rewarding, old-school and visually appealing. Compared to other free-to-play TCGs cards unlocking is less painful and it is easy to create the deck that you want just by playing the game.

Frequently updated and recently got its first huge 100+ card expansion. I haven't played with the expansion yet, but its release brought me back and I can't wait to try it.

My only criticism is that the game is a bit too similar to Magic and may turn off players that expect something different.

I personally know two of the devs, but tried to be as impartial as possible, even toning done my praise somewhat. I can vouch that they are great developers, they love TCGs and deserve your support.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074594449', 'num_games_owned': 104, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1213, 'last_played': 1470808896}
review:
Spellweaver is a special kind of TCG. It has the depth of the MTG mechanics without the card draw suck and the learning curve and fun factor of Hearthstone thanks to which the genre is seeing awesome new examples.

I love the art, it is bright, fresh and original and has a sort of a nostalgic note to it, something that reminds me of childhood games. I also like the music. It could use a bit more combat tracks but the sound and effects are cool without obscuring the game, something Hearthstone overdid.

You start with the familiar faction decks with the corresponding color lands or as they are called here "shrines", but your decks also revolve around the use of "heroes" and the hero's abilities - mana fed special abilities that the hero has or acquires through additional special shrines. They are useful enough to make a difference without shifting the focus from the faction mechanics. The heroes do not level but there are rarer versions with stronger powers worth the time and effort procuring.

The faction balance is quite good. The mechanics work well in pure decks as well as hybrid decks. You can build a creature deck just as easily as a spell damage or decay deck. The question then is what sort of games you could expect.

For the beginner and when doing "quests" - a generous way of procuring resources and cards without investing real money, which in comparison is far more giving than some other titles online, you can play against the AI. And I must say, the game AI is pretty obnoxiously good :) but that is not what TCGs are about - is it?

The best part of the game is the PvP part where you meet and play against real people. Here is one part of the game that you may want to consider in advance. The game has a very decent following but the players online tend to be available at certain times. There are times during the day when you may struggle to find a player and other times when it will take under 5s to get a new game when it seems everyone is online. My advice - send a lot of friend requests and check your roster to see when people are online.

That being said I have yet to try the tournament competitive part - I am still working on my decks and have a few more cards to craft and get, besides I have not used all the mechanics out there. There are some very interesting synergies between light and dark decks.

I recommend trying the game. It is free, it is fun and it is well done. It is also fairly generous and you can play your way through acquiring the cards you want. Finally from what I see on the forums there is a sophisticated and serious meta and a fairly friendly community you can learn from.

If you like TCGs give this one a try. You won't be disappointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018883546', 'num_games_owned': 365, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1470953976}
review:
Don't bother with this game unless you only want to play the AI for god knows how long..
The only PvP option's are Tournament (tickets required) Ranked (You need to be level 6) and Friendly (other than AI you can only play Friendly when you start the game).. 

There is no skillbased matching for these freindly games.. No chat, so there is no talking to all the experienced players you will meet in there who will stomp on you. Don't expect to win a single PvP game untill you've grinded the AI untill your Eyes and fingers bleed.

Don't get me wrong I'm always up for a challenge, but this isn't a challenge it's just a meat grinder for all the higher players with better cards and knowledge of the game to make them feel liks gods.

I'll stick to other games that actually have match making thanks! The ones worsth spending money on.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979535680', 'num_games_owned': 254, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 9230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2043, 'last_played': 1609785109}
review:
Pros:
 + Upgraded MTG with way less card draw RNG: you can search for lands every turn.
 + Including the best features of Hearthstone: lot of different heroes and hero powers, you can have 3 at once!
 + Fun new mechanics: speed (hero level and support line is new for most card games as well).
 + 0, zero! cards with the word 'random' on it. Finally.
 + Automated tournaments every day, sometimes 5-10 per 24 hours!!
 + Very generous rewards just for playing. Lot of gold, packs and random promotions about every half year.

Cons:
 - Terrible UI and lacklusting notifications and animations: sometimes my opponent plays a bunch of cards and passes turn and I have to waste time to backtrack and figure out what happened. No notification if a hero power recharged, you run out of cards, you have to pay extra mana, a synergy happens, something gains energy, etc. Super easy to miss card effects and mistakes / opportunities.
 - Unexplained mechanics: You have to figure out everything by trial and error.
  * For example I was in a long arena game and we had only a few cards left in deck so I thought I'd try what happens when I run out of cards and left my opponent on 1 HP with no board. Guess what? I lost. Then I had to play one vs. AI to find out what happens when time runs out...
  * Another great example is when the game literally says "Play spells or activate powers." and I have 4 spells in hand and can't play any of them.
  * Sometimes you can't use instant actions for a lifesaving effect. Why? You have to use them before combat which totally defeats the idea of instants.
 - Unreliable server:
  * I had games freeze on loading screen which looked like it was just loading and by the time I reconnected my opponent already passed 5 turns.
  * I had others freeze during game but the timer kept ticking which looks like your opponent is thinking but you're just disconnected. Again, takes minutes to realize.
  * Sometimes the client just disconnects.
  * These also happened to me in tournaments!!

Mixed:
 ? Terrible learning curve: the game is very complex which is a good thing but if you just started playing it takes a very long time to get familiar with all the card texts and combos.

review:
The game starts out fun enough. You get fairly easy tutorials with cheesie and lame jokes that i really could have done without. At first you probably want to stick to fighting bots to gather up some cash. Eventually you need to do some pvp to finish quests. And here is where i quit... Right away i only get to fight people with super efficient combo decks. Feels like fighting an uphill battle. Sometimes i could even see what my opponent was doing but they went from 1 mob on the field to 6 mobs and killing some of my mobs.

I did not spend any cash on this game. Since i tried many ccg, I never do that if i am not sure i am going to like the game.

review:
This is a really, really good card game. It has some very interesting mechanics, great artwork and cards, it works nearly without bugs, has tournaments for everybody and a great community.

Is it Pay 2 Win? No, not really. You can build nice decks without paying a dime due to the quest system which is very rewarding. Of course, if you want that expensive control deck with a lot of rare cards, you need to play a loooot or buy some packs. But I think that is just fair to pay the small team behind this great game.

Would always get addicted again!

author: {'steamid': '76561198007520909', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 5514, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2994, 'last_played': 1497512689}
review:
Spellweaver Review – 
TLDR:

I do not recommend this game as the paywall is very high. I think the very high paywall deters new players from staying. As a new player you can expect about a 60-80% loss rate on friendly/ranked games if you aren’t willing to spend $100+ USD. 

Positives:
Combat system much like MTG with a few modifications. – 8/10
Artwork has a nice fantasy quality. – 8/10
A resource system with low amounts of RNG problems. – 7/10

Negatives:
Free-To-Play versus Pay-To-Win – The model has a very high paywall resulting in a huge power gap. – 2/10
Card balance seems good if you have the full deck but there are just not enough decent substitutes. – 2/10
Card creation and exchange is designed to consume additional card value. – 3/10

New Player Essentials:
Every 5 character levels you will unlock a starter deck for free up until level 20.
Unlike MTG/Hearthstone creatures attacking creatures can only be blocked singly.

Balance:
At the time of this review I have played up to level 16. I have used two of the three new player Swiss draft tickets (32 payers). I placed 2nd and 3rd in those Swiss constructed with 4-1 records.  Losses were from someone who had spent real money (2nd) and RNG mana problems (3rd). These new player Swiss rounds really let you see what the game should feel like for new players where you are taking 1 to three started decks and around 10 packs and seeing what you can cobble together. If you have played a lot of draft Hearthstone or MTG it felt like that.

Pay Wall:
Once you start playing anything against the AI there is a huge difference. There are currently 24 epic/ 6 heroic cards which you can have up to 4 in a deck. There are 18 heroic heroes (6 from starter decks.). Epic Cards cost 150 color specific shrines. Heroic cards cost 200 color specific shrines. 12600 + 4800 + 2400 = 19800 shrines. Not every card is needed for top decks but it is useful when looking at that in comparison to the average shrines per pack.

There are 10 cards in the standard pack. Shrine disenchant value you is 20% of the creation value. Normal packs have a 7 common/2 uncommon/1 rare distribution with an epic occasionally taking the place of a common. The disenchant value of 1 pack is about 22 shrines. To craft a play set of all the epics/heroes/heroics you need to open approximately 900 packs. If the epic chance is 5% per pack you are looking at 600 packs.

600 packs will set you back about $895 USD. At this point you will be on equal footing.

Pay Wall versus Play Value:

Since the paywall is so high I felt completely outmatched in the “friendly games”. I was consistently getting matched against opponents whose decks are essentially 50% rare/epic. The power level and necessity of some cards versus creation costs makes for rough going. This type of matching says to me that there isn’t enough new players joining as MMR should be low enough that I face those opponents. 

I had a better win percentage in ranked games versus normal games because the MMR keeps those with newer collections from facing opponents with a full set of cards.

review:
O My Goood . This is one of best card games I ve ever played. 
 
Big Big Wooow for this production. I cannot stop playing this:D . 

+ 6 different factions to play(U can also mix them)
+  really cool fantasy climat and great music remind me old nostalgia gaming
+ game works smoothly. No lags . I didnt notice a single bug during 9 hours of gameplay
+ New game mechanic: Mixed MTG hearthstone and duel of champions. 
+ really hard to master and create strong deck
+ Short waiting for oponent time
+ Different Game modes: Tutorial, Solo Games , Map full of quests to complete, Unranked, Ranked, Drafts, Tournaments. 
+ The Game is not pay to win( You can buy packs and unlock new factions in store. You get plenty of strong playable cards during completing quests 
+ Amazing card images created by different painters really matching to the game
+ Card crafting
+ Different heroes in each factions with unique skills and abilities.
+ Polish and propably many other languages ( even flavor text on the cards:))

Now cons:

- At the beginnning you get access to only one faction. You can unlock another for Gold( gained during play) or by leveling (One new every 5 levels). Propably You  guys should let the player choose the staring factions but it takes max 2-3 hours to make lvl 5.
- takes some time to understand all game mechanics and stop making mistakes :D . Oh But is it a Con?
- Be Carefull.  SPELLWEAVER IS VERY VERY ADDICITIVE :)


If You r a fan of card games You have to give it a try. I did And Now Im mastering my Sweet deck instead of going out:)

author: {'steamid': '76561198002491408', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 25706, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22929, 'last_played': 1545453482}
review:
EDIT: the developers of this game continue to sabotage me by removing me from the group and thus making it so I can't post on the Steam forums. I would love to see them explain why. They've recently changed one of my epic quest rewards from a 12-pack box reward to a starter deck reward. I have all the starter decks and a nearly complete collection of cards. This means the system literally should not be able to give me this quest. https://i.imgur.com/VYHN9d5.jpg They've removed me from the group and changed my quest. Why?

First of all I have to say this game, at least gameplay-wise, does more than a few things right. The gameplay doesn't feel sluggish like Magic where basically any player can play anything at any time. It's streamlined here and frankly it's just better. There are six factions you can choose and mix however you like, much like in Magic. In this game, however, there are faction-specific heroes, similar to those of Hearthsone, of which there are two for each faction + one for each faction that were later on added as a kickstarter goal, but I will get to the specifics of that later. The mana system feels like an improved system from Magic, you may even be able to draw similarities with Hearthstone in this regard and you more often than not don't get screwed, but it's a card game and the random part is pretty much what you sign up for knowingly. I can hardly fault this game's gameplay, but I can't recommend it. Here is why.

1. Kickstarter goals

They didn't have it on the kickstarter website but this was de facto their kickstarter. https://i.imgur.com/G60THbo.jpg As you can tell only one of the features funded was implented so far. Archives will exist in this post to prove that as of the time of this review the pages presented as evidence were unedited. https://archive.is/zcTJj

I believe it's been 15 months since all of those were funded and the only one that was implented was implented very shortly after being funded. There were six heroes. They asked for $3500 for what, honestly, couldn't have possibly taken that long. Which was evident in how quickly they released it. In contrast we haven't heard a peep about the other things and honestly it seems as though they're hoping we forget them. I've only ever seen one other person ask about them recently. I was one of those backers. I donated $50 in March of 2015, I believe and at first I was glad I had. As you can assume reading this much has changed since then.

2. Constant bugs after every update
 
Every time they fix something, they break something. And these aren't miniscule things. Cards that literally crash the game are allowed to be used for days and when you play you can just hope the other play doesn't use the card to cheat you out of a win. Packs giving wrong cards. Yes, you were able to obtain cards in packs that you should've otherwise only been able to obtain by purchasing a faction's deck. They wail you with apologies and promises of compensation, but at some point hearing 'I love you' for the hundredth time in a day would get tiresome and seem disingenous. A more cynical person would say they do these things on purpose in order to create a buzz of their being "one of the good guys".

3. Dissent bans

If you aren't being welcoming to whichever change is being implented, 'krip'(one of the employees) will be sure to visit you with a passive aggressive, sometimes mocking, message that being negative is not welcome. Perhaps even a ban if you don't toe the line. I am not the only who has suffered this. Not being insulting. Not because you even uttered a profanity. Just dissent will get you. If you look through his post history on their forums, this will be evident.

4. Legality of certain things

Why the hell is one of their employers giving a (positive) review of their game without stating he's employed by them? He's the lead artist of Dream Reactor. Especially his art comment is just bizarre. https://archive.is/gvWog https://archive.is/jMpdY https://youtu.be/v8zhlDDKTD0?t=29s If this isn't illegal, it's at least unethical.

5. Professional scene

The very top of the top players are essentially being paid by Dream Reactor. The community is small and in this community there are hardly any newcomers that can compete with them. Some of the reasons are following. The top 10 or top 20 people on the fame leaderboard are the same people as the people in these money prize tournaments. Fame is basically measured in how many games you've played. If you play ranked, you gain more than in casual. If you win, you gain more than if you lose. These people literally have all of the cards and will defend any changes that affect the monetary gain of Dream Reactor at the expense of the players. New players have a harder time collecting the cards = the better players among these new players have a harder time competing with the top. Some of the latter mentioned people have YouTube channels with patreons set up and linked in their channels. They are intent on keeping themselves at the top. While smart on their part and not really the fault of Dream Reactor, it's one of the reason I wouldn't recommend this game.

6. Recently introduced heroic rarity

They introduced 6 new cards with this rarity. They changed the 18 heroes already in the game to this rarity. 6 of them aren't supposed to be obtainable with card packs. What this means is if you are an existing player you are twice as likely to get something you already have. Oh, yeah. The cards from the expansion you obtain through the same packs as the base set. If you want to only gain the expansion cards, the only way you can do that is by spending real money and not their ingame currency. In this game the rarity is as follows: Common, Uncommon, Rare, Epic, Heroic. The number of rares and epics is bigger than in the base set. On top of that they added the heroic rarity.

If you only care about gameplay and not honest business then this is the perfect game for you. Honestly, it fills both criteria exceptionally well. I've been with this game for 15 months, spent hundreds of hours on it during its existence and I believe my words count for more than most people's when it comes to this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198101641713', 'num_games_owned': 61, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 519, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 367, 'last_played': 1469613633}
review:
你说你是万智牌和炉石的儿子，我对你的父母甚是仰慕。联想到二老的样子，想必你一定是风度翩翩，玉树临风，知书达理，家财万贯。可当我们见面以后，我发现基因表达是个有趣的问题。基因优美的两人结合，生出的有可能是两者之精华，也有可能是一道叫做东北大乱炖的菜。 

    史诗题材，六大种族，还分了正义和邪恶两大阵营，请联盟和部落对号入座。
    还是地牌的模式，但放弃了地牌的桌游特性，每回合拥有地牌补救措施，降低了没有费用的情况，后手还拥有一个一次性的费用使用机会。（地牌+费用水晶+后手硬币）
    攻击后横置机制，但能攻击生物。（是亲生的）
    攻击速度和援助阵线的特点属于基因突变，算是惊喜。但对战细节的丰富和操作时间的设定，使得整体游戏节奏偏慢

    还有，从你类似国产页游界面的衣着来看，似乎你并没有继承父辈的殷实家底和品位格调。况且你家WiFi似乎不太好，我们还是做朋友吧。

review:
推荐码KSVR4A，填了可以拿75000金币。
总体上还是挺不错的游戏，结合了万智牌与炉石进行了不少改进。
和炉石比起来多了资源管理方面的策略性，针对万智牌类游戏地牌卡手的问题作了很大的优化，与万智对决以及HEX比起来卡手概率少了很多，对战显得更加流畅。
缺点还是卡池暂时比较浅，玩家数量也比较少，不过幸亏人少，和服务器的连接还算稳定。。。
总之作为娱乐消遣还是不错的啦orz

author: {'steamid': '76561198065654207', 'num_games_owned': 173, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1069, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 842, 'last_played': 1678886231}
review:
先贴邀请码：SGC2KF
游戏总体不错的，但是有两点我很蛋疼：
1、服务器连接不咋地，时断时好，导致游戏进程慢，要等一下才有反应；
2、战役可以玩，但剧情缺乏。

author: {'steamid': '76561198119499305', 'num_games_owned': 1890, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 6829, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6302, 'last_played': 1470315730}
review:
First off, I would rather give this game a neutral instead of yes or no, but Steam doesn't provide this choice.

I like to play these card games and I have played Hearthstone more than 2 years. I was frustrated because in HS there are a lot of bots and cheaters so I quit.
Getting used to Spellweaver took quite some time, because it is more complex. In HS you basically have only attack and defense and the hero class plays not such a big role. In Spellweaver you have the more properties you have to take into account. The type (choosen with shrines), the speed, and of course attack and defense.
These additional characteristics make the game much more deeper, but there are several problems I don't like about it.

In order to play even a single card, you have to play "Shrine" cards which determine what class of cards you can play, and here starts the first big problem.
The most implortant part of such a game is that you get an more or less even balance choice of cards. Now there is always a radnom element in an card game, but it is very frustrating if you get no shrinse, and you can't even play a card because of that. Of course, you can always sacrifice a card to hoepfully get a shrine for it, but but there is no garuantee to get one and of course you loose your playing card if you have to do that.
Or it very frequently happens the other way around. You get almost no playable cards and only shrines, which is even worse, because there is not really much you can do against it. You just have to wait and hope for some playable card while your oponnent kills you off.

Another thing is that the cards feel rather unbalanced. It is often that you loose or win just because there is basically only one or two cards in play that are so overpowered that there is no chance to counter it, which makes playing rather frustrating.

You can play either against the AI (which can be very strong because of the above issues) or against other players. However, there seem not to be so many players around, so I often end up playing against the AI instead, because you simply find no oponnent.

Compared to Hearthstone, you can get more easily new cards buy playing missions and for the rewards buy new packs, which in turn you can craft for new cards. The good thing is that you can play completely free, because you can buy frequently new packs from the goldyou win. The bad thing is, that the card varietey is very limited, so you can get basically all important cards rather fast. 

Overall I like the game despite the issues and I will continue playing it, but I' can't wholheartedly recommend it.

review: Excellent fantasy trading card game. Reminds of Magic the Gathering, only with slightly different mechanics, notably hero abilities and the concept of creature speeds (can't defend if your creatures are toos slow). Beautiful artwork and interface. I still have a slight preference for MTG, but this game offers an infinitely better interface and is much cheaper to get into; in fact, you can just get free packs by play matches. My only complaint is the battle interface, which causes the table to split momentarily; it's unnecessary and annoying. Otherwise, I'm really enjoying it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077023798', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 7794, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7580, 'last_played': 1474259344}
review:
Edited 9/29/16 from Positive to Negative.

In my original review I groused about the lack of a neutral review option, but ultimately ended up leaning positive. Unfortunately, after some ~130 hours in, I've come to tilt the opposite way, but stand by my initial assessment that it should be viewed much closer to 'Neutral' than either extreme, and if you're a diehard fan of the genre, I think it's still definitely worth getting a feel for if only to better judge the industry as a whole. Also, if you consider yourself a competitive CCG player, I would shift this review to positive.

In brief: Spellweaver is a solid CCG that really doesn't do anything particularly bad in terms of pure mechanics. That said, it also really doesn't offer much in the way of innovation to a rapidly expanding genre. In crude terms, SW is a mesh of Magic: The Gathering and MMDoC, so if you like those, you'll like this gameplay. A word of caution to prospective FTP players, as it is currently (as of September '16) very stingy, despite what other outdated reviews may say.

PROS:

+One free no-penalty mulligan limits bad draws.
+Decentish daily/weekly rewards once you've reached mid-tier levels, but requires a lot of grind early on before you can actually take advantage of this. Note: if you do try the game, use your early gold towards unlocking the starting factions, and never buy the Good/Evil packs.
+Artwork is solid.
+Rare and legendary cards aren't auto-include OP.
+Monthly cash tournament for the competitive crowd.
+Active (if small) dev team that engages with its community.

NEUTRAL:

+-One free resource "searching" allowed per turn (return one card from hand to deck to search next 5 cards for a resource, placing the rest to the bottom of your deck). In my initial review I placed this in the PRO category, but with more time I've found that because it isn't guaranteed, all that it changes from other resource draw games like Magic is the ratio of resources you run in any given deck. Its main function at the higher levels of play is actually to 'see' your deck, since returned cards are all placed in order on the bottom, so you can eventually cycle through your entire deck and know your coming draws if you kept track.
+-Extremely derivitive of MtG. Red = Zerg Rush Goblins + Burn Spells. Green = Overwhelm Elves. Black = Control Zombies with Graveyard Mechanics. Etc. If you know MtG/MMDoC everything will be immediately familiar, with only a few minor alterations (e.g. resource mechanics, an extra faction, and the inclusion of "Speed" as a unit feature limiting who can block what).

CONS:

-Originally I had the diversity of tournaments listed as a PRO, but currently the reward structure is not close to being equitable in terms of time invested, and consequently the majority of daily and weekly tournaments go unfilled (with plenty of one-and-dones murkying the mix too). On the + side, the devs are definitely aware of this deficit and intend to restructure tournament rewards in the future.
-Originally I had the card crafting system as a PRO, but upon further review it's absolute rubbish. Playing daily to the tune of 130 hours in and I can barely craft a single Legendary card per faction. Simply put, it's way too unforgiving to be of any use in filling out a deck.
-Compounding the above issue is that with the first major expansion came a new rarity level, Heroic, which if Legendary cards were hard to get, these are impossible. This rarity level includes 4-of cards as well as the Heroes needed to run specific deck archetypes, making it impossible for new players to try certain deck types for possibly months if not more.
-No compelling shop items for non-whales. I have no compunction against tossing a little money at a CCG, but I'm not a whale and I never found anything in the shop that seemed worth its value.
-Tutorial is bad to non-existent.

SUMMATION: 

This is a solid if not particularly original CCG, with attractive features for competitive players (limited RNG + cash tournaments). It is currently very inhospitable to FTP, and other reviews touting it as being 'generous' are referring to an incarnation of the game that no longer exists. It is extremely difficult to build a competitive collection without paying exorbitant costs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039477359', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 10085, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4578, 'last_played': 1566086049}
review:
Spellweaver überzeugt auf beinahe ganzer Linie:

+ mit einem Code könnt ihr andere einladen, dafür bekommen diese 75k Gold und ihr einen Bonus je nach Levelfortschritt; mein Code lautet: NRQX6E ; also wenn ihr NRQX6E eingebt erhaltet ihr zusätlich 75k Gold Startkapital ;)
+ sehr innovatives Manasystem; meiner Meinung nach um Längen besser als bei MTG 
+ noch genialer allerdings sind die Kreaturen, die neben Attacke/Widerstandsfähigkeit auch noch einen Schnelligkeitswert haben und man als Angreifer bestimmen kann welche Kreatur attackiert wird ( solange die Angreifer-Kreatur schnell genug dafür ist ;) )
+ Quests ermöglichen relativ raschen Fortschritt; deshalb möglichst alle Gebiete freischalten um Quests zu erhalten!
+ Craftingsystem; leider etwas aufwendig zu Beginn
+ sehr viele verschiedene Turniere mit Preisen; sogar monatliche Turniere für die besten Spieler, die Geldpreise erhalten können!

+- keine Soforteffekt-Stapelei möglich; d.h. eine Kreatur die zB von einem Feuerball getötet wird kann nicht noch schnell eine Fähigkeit nutzen; auch ein "Aufpumpen" mit Sprüchen ist nicht möglich 

- Balancing für Friendly Games noch etwas unausgegoren; dafür hatte ich aber noch keine längere Wartezeit als 70 Sekunden
- übliche 4er Regel für Karten; also abgesehen von Basic Schreinen (Manaquelle) ist jede Karte bis zu 4 mal erlaubt; hier finde ich die MTG Duels - Regel (1 mal mythic, 2 mal rare...) besser

Alles in allem ein super TCG, das noch in den Anfängen steckt, aber ein gewaltiges Potenzial besitzt!

p.s. dies ist mein erstes Review; zum einen hoffe ich natürlich, dass ein paar Leute meinen Code (NRQX6E) eingeben und ich so etwas Fortschritt im Spiel "geschenkt" bekomme; zum anderen mache ich diese Review um noch mehr Spieler für dieses Game zu gewinnen, weil es einfach so genial gemacht ist!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198291133297', 'num_games_owned': 54, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 23628, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1141, 'last_played': 1559931141}
review:
Ho scoperto questo gioco tramite un sito che offriva un codice bonus e devo ammettere che, nonostante all'inizio lo reputassi troppo macchino, si è rivelato un gioco molto interessante e accativante.

Pregi:
- Diversi tipi di carte giocabili e un mazzo di partenza di almeno 60 carte (60 è il minimo ma si possono anche aggiungere le carte extra). Abbiamo creature, incantesimi, incantesimi istantanei, templi e artefatti.
- Diverse modalità di gioco. Quick battle (contro giocatori o contro il computer), Trials (provate una sola volta) e missioni per guadagnare crediti o carte (generalmente prevedono un numero di quick battle o di fama da guadagnare ma ci sono anche degli incontri PvE.
- Possibilità di acquistare nuovi pacchetti di carte in gioco. Vanno da 5000 crediti per i pacchetti piccoli a 12500 per quelli più grossi. Se siete interessati ad una certa categoria, vi sono anche mazzi più specifici a 17000 crediti.
- Possibilità di avere più mazzi personalizzabili. Guadagnerete la possibilità di ricevere un mazzo gratuitamente ogni 5 livelli, ciò significa che a livello 10 potrete scegliere tra almeno 3 mazzi.

Difetti:
A parte le quick battle contro l'IA e i PvE occasionali, il gioco appare un po' scarno, per chi vuole giocare contro il computer. Affrontare altri giocatori non mi dispiace ma non mi dispiacerebbe neanche vedere qualche campagna a giocatore singolo. Ciò nonostante, consiglio il gioco e spero che in futuro vengano introdotte nuove modalità di gioco.
