author: {'steamid': '76561198038051947', 'num_games_owned': 479, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 3935, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2172, 'last_played': 1461652713}
review:
Поскольку жадные визарды - не только жадные, а еще и медленные, а что-то подобное напрашивалось в пустующую нишу сетевых решений для ККИ давно - очень неплохо.

Плюсы:
Привносит свежести и разделение земель на тип и цену(в однйо карточке) - набрав комбу из GW можно играть любые карты с GW - 1W - 1G - лишь бы маны хватало)к примеру за 5 кристаллов и собраные атрибуты G и W можно сыграть 1 карту с ценой 1 кристалл и атрибутом G, 1 карту с ценой 2 и аттриюутами GW и 1 карту с за 2 и с аттрибутами 1W. И это - в любых комбах), цикл встроен во все карты (хоть и работает только на земли, зато - на все, уникальные - в том числе), в связи с прошлым пунктом - мультиколор гораздо легче балансится (а если вставить синий - то еще легче), наконец-то можно набрать полные набор (а не урезанные по воле разрабов. НУ не нужно мне 1 или 2 или даже 3 копии карты. Мне нужно 4. Точка, абзац  прибрежные). 
Приятности добавляют дейлики, аз которые очень быстро (примерно неделю) вы сможете собрать что-то действительно играющее. Ну хотя бы для того, чтобы гарантированно выигрывать компов на харде.
Фритуплей же! И снова - выкусите, визарды :")
Турниры. Есть, пока прошел первый, на который позвали именитых матыжников - можно посмотреть записи и деклисты на сайте разрабов. выигрывшим выплатили денег. Немного, но все равно внушает :")

Из минусов: 
Пока мало... всего. Инстантов, крич, механик - ну всего. Все надеются.
Недружелюбна к новичкам - нет, серьезно. Людям, совершенно не знакомым с мотыгой 2/3 происходящего будет просто непонятно. Обучалка довльно скомканная, хотя и понятная.
Чувствуется полом на зеленых. Ну, это было и в мотыге. Хотя там белым сплешили в своё время для окончательного решения. Надеюсь со врменем выправят.
Денюжек просят серьезно. Но если никуда не торопиться - можно вытащить из бустеров за дейлики, купить за бабло за дейлики или скрафтить, на худой конец.

В сухом остатке - как я и писал в самом начале - стоит попробовать поиграть. Денег для начала не вкладывайте только, чтобы побыстрее "бижатьнагибать" в ранкед. Хотя и будет сильно хотеться.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130081450', 'num_games_owned': 194, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1419, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 258, 'last_played': 1610376869}
review:
Как игрок, имевший опыт в таких проектах, как Magic: The Gathering и Hearthstone (наиграл около 2к матчей), могу сказать, что Spellweawer - это новый уровень в жанре ККИ.
В игре нет никакого намёка на казуал: только хардкор, только грамотные расчёты, минимум рандома и так далее.
Я мог бы очень долго строчить о своих размышлениях, о том, как сильно эта игра поглотила меня, но здесь от меня необходим лишь краткий обзор.
В общем, у Spellweawer'а есть огромное количество плюсов, а именно:
+ приятная,  детализованная графика
+ отличное музыкальное сопровождение (спокойная музыка = сосредоточенность в игре)
+ достаточно проработанный баланс
+ уникальная механика игры, где каждый аспект имеет свои отличия и тактики
+ низкая зависимость к донату
+ и, да-да, это относится к невнимательным игрокам. В игре есть СМЕНА ЯЗЫКА, среди которых есть и русский. Данное окно находится в нижней правой части экрана во время заполнения данных аккаунта.
Минус, пожалуй, только один - малое разнообразие карт, но это дело поправимое, учитывая, что игра вышла в начале февраля, а разработчики неустанно пилят обновы с фиксами, маленькими доработками и т.п.
Так что... Советую поиграть всем читателям этого обзора. Возможно, уделив хотя бы часок своего времени на этот шедевр, вы обретёте для себя любимую игру.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053919877', 'num_games_owned': 286, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 3347, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2099, 'last_played': 1510635958}
review:
Simply put, this card game takes a lot of the aspects of card games that are simply infuriating and tosses them straight out the window while maintaining all of the things that make card games fun. For those of you looking for a methodical, and strategic card game then this is certainly a game you should try.

For those of you who would like to read on, here are some specific examples.

Annoying things that are gone:
 - Card collection is much easier than other games, such as Hearthstone, say, because there are quests that give you cards of a certain rarity that you don't already have! Furthermore, if you are willing to spend money on the game you can also get   "premium packs" which, assuming you haven't collected all cards of a particular rarity, give you only cards you havent received already.
 - If you get screwed over by not getting a resource card you need, once per turn you can shuffle one card into your deck in exchange for a resource card off of the top 5 cards in your deck. The other 4 cards you didn't select are shuffled back into your deck
 - No more arbitrary class restriction!! Classes only exist in the sense that you have to invest your resources into one of six aspects in order to play their cards in addition to their mana cost.
 - Turn timers in this game work similar to professional chess games. You have a timer that is only ticking when it is your turn, and you can sit and take 5 minutes to take your turn if you really want to. For those of you concerned about people intentionally taking too much time, there is a warning that pops up on the screen if you take too long and will skip your turn if you don't answer the prompt. Furthermore, the community in this game is usually pretty good about taking only the time that they need to finish their turns.


Generally good things:
 - Very easy to learn, but very difficult to master. You can win the game by healing yourself, killing your opponent, or through exceptional cards that win the game for you based on specific conditions. Furthermore, the addition of a support line, blocking, and exhaustion lead to interesting strategic choices.
 - Good community that is generally respectful! Very few BM finishes.
 - The addition of heroes: For those of you who play Hearthstone there are classes that have hero powers. As an interesting twist in spellweaver, you can use any hero that you want to with any other set of cards; however, in order to use their hero power you have to have the adequete amount of resources. These effects range from the somewhat insignificant to the incredibly powerful in the correct decks. Furthermore, you can empower your hero to gain an addition al 2 powers that have equally powerful effects.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052229355', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 19062, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3337, 'last_played': 1592310283}
review:
Si te gusta Magic, y sobre todo, si piensas que al Hearthstone le falta la posibilidad de bloquear, este juego es para ti.

Con un sistema de recursos usando "tierras" de dos formas, una para ganar un cristal de mana del estilo del hearthstone (con el plus de robar carta), y otro ganando niveles de facción (de forma algo similar a la necesidad de mana de color de magic), más la posibilidad de escoger una carta de tu mano, mirar las 5 primeras cartas de tu biblioteca para tener la oportunidad de encontrar una tierra (la carta escogida y el resto de las miradas son puestas en el fondo en orden aleatorio) hacen que un sistema de recursos de los más completo.

En el apartado de combate, con el añadido del atributo de velocidad, haciendo que tus criaturas puedan atacar o bloquear a criaturas mas lentas que ellas, hacen que, en mi opinion, la estrategia del combate sea más interesante que en magic o hearthstone.

La rapided con la que se consiguen las cartas me parece más que aceptable, yo no llevo mucho tiempo jugado y casi solo me faltan cartas miticas y raras.

y lo más importante, en mi opinion, un juego muy adictivo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023535139', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 4705, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4600, 'last_played': 1460902831}
review:
If Hearthstone and Magic: The Gathering would have had a baby, it's name would be Spellweaver.

With collectible card games, 3 questions always arise:
1) It is pay to win?
2) It is balanced?
3) What sets it apart from the other card games?

[b]1) It is pay to win?[/b]
No, I believe not. There are daily quests and there is no limit to the amount of gold you can collect (without paying). Also, while leveling, you get a lot of free stuff, like gold, card decks and booster packs. For a small card pack you have to win 20 matches against the AI or 5 matches in ranked. Which is fair.

[b]2) It is balanced?[/b]
No, in it's current stage the game is not yet balanced. Certain factions have better cards and more synergy. But this is only really noticeable against high ranking players. As a casual player you'll probably not have many issues. Something I personally had an issue with was bad opening hands. The RNG can be pretty annoying sometimes.

[b]3) What sets it apart from the other card games?[/b]
You won't find anything new here. You can test your skills against players using your own deck in a friendly match, ranked match or in tournaments held every few days or you could also just play against the AI. Alternatively, you can play trials in which you construct a deck on the fly (draft) and try to win 10 games. Finally, you can do the daily quests and level up your character for extra rewards.


Overall it's a pretty interesting game.

review:
THE most generous f2p game i know, and the first one i can wholeheartedly advice everyone to play

plays very much like magic with familiar abilities like flying, ranged(first strike), deady ...
while giving itself its own note as well
(each minion has a speed stat deciding what other minons it can attack/block, you can trade a card each turn for a chance to get a mana shrine if you want, to avoid mana screw, etc) 

and imo the best aspect on top of that
true f2p

you get a bunch of daily quests offered each day 
and can accept one per faction(usually 3 in total)
which award you money, or even better, possibly cards, small packs, normal packs, or crystals, the real money currency

quests can be done against real players

wins and losses both rewards gold, so you dont ever waste your time playing a match

after the inital realease the servers were kinda buggy, 
and the reviews of those times show that
but thats fixed now, i havent had any issues in ages

all in all its a great game, and my favorite currently
id say the best actual f2p game on the CCG market

thus the verdict can only be RECOMMENDED
really, give it a try

author: {'steamid': '76561198271172534', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 26028, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24537, 'last_played': 1512961875}
review:
Rewriting review. 

While a fun game, it is not new player friendly. The tutorial explains the basics, but the intricacies and implications that are leveraged by more experienced players are left for the new player to experience first hand.

Gameplay is fun, but the crafting system is very tricky. It's quite punishing if you disenchant cards across aspects. Cards are crafted using shrines from their own aspect. If you use another aspect's shrines, there is a 50% loss. Completing an entire set from scratch has a sort of lefthand bell curve. Difficult for the first bit, reasonably fast for the middle bit, and then very slow to acquire the last remaining cards (generally the epics and heroics).

Smallish playerbase, so once you start to rank up (above rank 200? <- ballpark), you'll start playing against veterans who have a larger collection and are able to leverage their card collection.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079437844', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 770, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 586, 'last_played': 1459156250}
review:
Summary:

A nice mix of what is good about Hearthstone and Magic. The main draw for me personally is that it fixes what I dislike most about magic oustide of the massive money investment you need to play Magic. It accelerates acquizition of land cards or in this game, shrines. If you've ever hated not drawing lands Spellweaver has a system in which you can shuffle one card of your choice back into the deck and look at the top 5 cards of your deck, if any are shrines(lands) you can add that to your hand. That and the fact that the shrines are more mulilayered, some giving you new hero powers for example and the fact that you can choose whether you want to increase your mana(which is identical to HS in use but not in how you acquire it) or power level which is a flat resource that never depletes but is required to play certain cards.

So for me that's huge, I hated having to draw land cards in the f2p versions of Magic and potentially not being able to play anything. This keeps the game fun and fast without the need for cards that ramp up your lands like in Magic.


Outside of that, the game is very much like Magic except with the addition of the mechanic I listed and the hero power mechanics, which change the game very drastically. The card art and certain card designs, effects and archetypes are very familiar if you play Magic. But it's unique enough to not feel like a complete copy. There are more complex mechanics like the support line and the speed mechanic and the way in which you block is a bit different than Magic as well. So don't be fooled by it's appearance. There's a lot to enjoy here and a lot of fun unique mechanics to learn.

CONS:

Crafting/Disenchanting

My main issue with the game right now is the way in which you disenchant cards to craft new ones. You use shrines as currencies, which if you read what I said before are lands. The problem in this game is you need to specifically have shrines for the color in which you are crafting for. And not just that, you need to have at least 20 shrines at all times, so you can't disenchant below that. Why does this matter? Well, at the start you have 0 shrines, you get 20 from the starter decks. So what this means is, you need to either one disenchant a lot of cards of a certain color to first meet the 20 shrine limit before you can even start earning shrines that will go towards disenchanting OR you have to unlock the starter deck for each class which costs 40k gold, which is about 3 packs(it's quite a lot). You can get starter decks by leveling up but it will take a lot of hours to do this. So realistically you'll be spending either a lot of time or potentially money to get enough shrines to make cards you want. Which is nothing new, but the way in which you do it in Spellweaver is very unintuitive. Rather than have a flat rate, it's set up behind this 20 shrine minimum and not just that you have to then transfer shrines from different colors over to the color in which you want to create a card for, but not just that, it taxes you shrines, so the exchange rate isn't even a 1-1 ratio. Imagine in HS if you disenchanted a Hunter card but then had to transfer the dust to Mage first before being able to use it for a Mage card of your choice, but that 100 dust you got from disenchanting got reduced to 80. You'd be pissed. 

Art, UI and Game Options

So if you've taken a second to look at the gameplay, you'll notice right off the bat that this game does not have the most unique appearance. It's card art looks very similar to Magic, it's main menu while efficient in what it does is bland. Even the name isn't interesting. It comes off too much like a Magic clone, and that will hurt it imo. It could really use a rehaul in a lot of areas to help give it it's own unique style that it really needs. The game options however are bare bones, the game is locked at 30 fps and while there is a windowed mode, you cannot adjust the resolution of it, so you'll be stuck with an awkward and ugly game window if you choose to go that route while playing. The 30 fps isn't too bad, you'll get used to it but if you go from other TCGs that run higher you might be annoyed by it.

Conclusion:

Overall though, it's a very good game. Fixes thing you might dislike from other TCGs and innovates with it's own twists. The areas in which it lacks while very important can be adjusted and overcome. The core gameplay is great and fills a solid niche between Magic and Hearthstone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008905323', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1548, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1451, 'last_played': 1491338871}
review:
Why should one care about this game, when the market of digital CCG is so full. Well, a lot of reasons, to be honest, but for that review we will have a look at what I feel personally makes this game stand out from the "big" competitors.

Comparing to Hearthstone:

Hearthstone is an amazingly polished product with a surprising amount of depth, but, to be fair, the expectations of depth for HS are really low to begin with. It is extremely reliant on RNG, has tons of absolutely unplayable cards and a very unfriendly free-to-play model, where the daily income is limited.

It is also extremely limited when it comes to core gameplay, since the class cards cannot be used by any other class, making for a much lower possible combinations count than it is necessary. The latest "format" restriciton only exacerbates this problem and its current state the game is extremely lacking.

Spellweaver, on the other hand, stays true to the MTG roots, but brilliantly improves on the concept of "land cards" as resources. There are mechanics in the game which allow players to dive for lands, while all lands themselves are either cyclable for free or come with a nice ability of their own. Really interesting stuff and an improvement of depth over hearthstone in terms of resource management while an improvement of quality of life over MTG. Spellweaver sits somewhere in the middle and is really enjoayble and mostly frustration-free.

There is also possibility of reaction on enemy's turn—something I personally feel lacking in HS. Instant spells are not quite as powerful as in MTG and they are truly instant in nature (there is no direct counterplay to spells afaik) and they add to the amount of options available to the player a great deal. Whether #of options=extra depth is still a question, after all im only 12 hours in, but the game is certainly enjoyable.

Finally, even with a rather limited pool of cards the amount of possible deck archetypes is already baffling. It is quite possible to make a semiworking mill, aggro, heavy control and even hexproof strategies seem to be worth exploring. All of this is possible with the ability to build decks with practically any card in it. Amazing and gives a truly MTG feeling.

Okay, with this true MTG feeling in mind the logical question arises—why not just play Hex: Shards of Fate?

I gave the Hex an honest try and it is Hex forums themselves which allowed me to find the hidden gem Spellweaver is. Hex is... clunky, it is atrociously ugly and it has no free-to-play model. Well, there is, but not really.

The company behind it has tried to create Magic Online and they have succeeded—they did exactly that. Then they added bells and whistles to the original formula which arguably made the game worse and currently try to sell it as their own "product". The worst part is it has failed to be a digital-era CCG we wanted it to be—as deep as magic, but more accessible. It can be considered as deep as MTG (though some of the mechanics in Hex are questionable and very random), but it is certainly not accessible. The friendly (no kappa) in-game community has said that you can farm enough gold for a booster in about 3 hours in the Frost Ring Arena with a good deck. To farm to a good deck it generally takes 30-40 hours of actual grinding in PvE zones and completion of "campaigns" for different heroes... In my book even the HS tutorial is way too long before one can get into PvP action. The amount of time needed to get into actual PvP without spending money is ridiculous. And the game searching takes ages...

Spellweaver has given me a starter deck which was built by a fully functioning CCG player and not some random joe who just picked the pictures he liked better. Spellweaver allowed me to customise said deck as soon as I got extra cards. It has not been holding my hand when I didn't ask it to, but has provided helpful advice. And it allowed me to unlock 4 extra starter decks in the first 12 hours of gameplay, as well as several 10-card boosters. The flow of the first 12 hours ahs been amazing with more and more option opening up and most of them being valid and I am yet to play the "trials".

I am not sure whether Spellweaver will keep on being an excellent game or the Devs will manage to screw the game up as Ubisoft did with MMDoC (amazing CCG killed by Ubi's greed), but as it stands now, the game is worth at least trying.

author: {'steamid': '76561198149037095', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 910, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 632, 'last_played': 1461183807}
review:
Ever since Hearthstone came out of beta, I've been thinking - all right, this is great fun, but can I have something more strategic, please? A game that is less about playing the optimal hand every turn and more about making tactical decisions that matter? 
Spellweaver might just be that game. 
There have been many entries in the digital deckbuilding game scene over the past few years, but somehow most of them have managed to take a step in the wrong direction, be it an unreasonable business model, unbalanced gameplay, bad developer support or simply lackluster production values.
Spellweaver, however, is attempting to tick all the right boxes and is doing a good job so far. It will look immediately familiar to everyone who has played a dueling card game, but has enough unique twists to the classic formula to grab their attention. The rules are easy to comprehend, but there are many strategic layers to be found and a lot of room for experimentation. It's also still very fresh, so new players shouldn't have any trouble amassing a decent collection of cards. The business model is pretty generous in that regard. So if you want to get in on the ground floor, now is the time.
Apart from that, the game has some exciting deckbuilding possibilities. The are six different card factions and, unlike Hearthstone, Spellweaver supports multi-faction decks. The game is currently at the stage where it's really exciting to see where it goes with future card releases. If it manages to develop an interesting and reasonably dynamic meta, this game could really shine among other competitors.
The overall presentation is great as well - nothing spectacular, but nicely polished and professional-looking. If there's one complaint I have, it's that the animations can feel too slow and "floaty", which needlessly drags down the pace of an otherwise intense tactical affair. 
Also, in-game communication is a bit strange: there's a fully functional chat window on the overworld map, but once you're in a match, all means of communication are gone. No chat window, no emotes, nothing. I fully support the idea of minimizing verbal abuse in competitive games, but this doesn't solve the problem and most of the time just feels limiting.
But those are minor issues, of course - nothing that should keep you from giving Spellweaver a try.

TL;DR: If you're looking for a quality ccg that's not too convoluted, not too shallow and sports a good business model, this could be it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043063170', 'num_games_owned': 82, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 2652, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1967, 'last_played': 1459312899}
review:
This game is great, especially if you're a player of Magic: The Gathering or a similar game like The Spoils. It's got a great blend of mechanics that make it a really deep, rich game with lots of possible strategies. The speed mechanic especially brings a lot of depth to the gameplay, and it keeps big monsters in check. The resource system (levels and mana) takes a bit of getting used to, but the unique way they handle playing resources, as well as a mechanic that helps you "fish" for a needed mana, helps keep down the likelihood of not having any resources with which to play your cards.

While it could be said that you can "pay to win", since as with any TCG you can just plonk down a bunch of money for a bunch of packs and get a lot of rares, there's no cards that you have to pay real money for, and a simple quest system (as well as ample rewards from playing games, especially Friendly and Ranked) means that you can easily earn plenty of packs. The level-up system also unlocks rewards, sometimes large lump sums of gold, and other times a free starter deck  (which can also be bought for 40k gold, or real money if you prefer). For an example, I recently won a Ranked Game which took about 20 minutes, and earned 2,000 gold, with the other player earning half that. 2000 gold is about 1/6th the price of a normal booster pack, though you can spend more to get a pack with better odds of getting certain types of cards. Again, all of this can be paid for with in-game gold. There are cosmetic things (card backs, mostly), but everything else can be bought with gold, or crafted using the in-game crafting system. 

There are also weekly tournaments, as well as other events going on pretty frequently. We don't have a constant global community chat, yet, though hopefully the devs will put one in soon. We do have a chat during the Sunday Funday tourneys, though, so you should come say hi!

author: {'steamid': '76561198095272525', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1140, 'last_played': 1490940820}
review:
As a longtime MTG, Hearthstone, Hex, Pokemon, and Yugioh player, I can say that this is without a doubt the best TCG/CCG on the market today. One of my biggest complaints about MTG and Hex was the fact that you could have a fantastic deck and still lose because you got "mana screwed" every once in awhile. It sucks when it happens and took the fun right out of the game sometimes. Thankfully in Spellweaver they have implemented a new system called "Divine Offering" to mitigate the chances of losing due to lack of resources. This allows each hero to remove a card from their hand  and look at the top 5 cards of their deck. If there is a resource card among them, that player may add it to their hand, it not they get nothing. This effect can only be used once per turn and does not discard the card from the hand so that it can't be abused with stuff that tampers with the graveyard. 

No amount of words can explain how good this game is compared to MTG and Hex, so I suggest you download it and play it for yourself. It's free! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198027931991', 'num_games_owned': 134, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1458591519}
review:
Estava até demorando para aparecer mais card games dignos a pegarem uma fatia do mercado. Spellweaver é mais estratégico que Hearthstone e menos complicado que MTG. O sistema de quest te recompensa de verdade, e é relativamente fácil de colecionar as cartas, não precisando investir dinheiro logo de cara, a não ser que você queira cosméticos ou acelerar seus ganhos (tirei uma lendária e 3 heróis logo nos 4 primeiros packs).

O tutorial deixa um pouco a desejar, pois não explica todas as mecânicas do jogo, mas jogando algumas partidas contra IA (o que também te recompensa) já da pra ir pegando o jeito. Sistema de torneios in-game e a leaderboard é em tempo real, que eu não entendo porque a Blizzard ainda não colocou no Hearthstone. 

Se você é fã de card games dê uma olhada em Spellweaver. De uma procurada sobre ele no Google e descubra que existem gift-cards sendo distribuidos já que o game é novo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073809145', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 13075, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 532, 'last_played': 1592515771}
{'steamid': '76561198006635919', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 4213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2876, 'last_played': 1609177764}
review:
Spellweaver offers a really interesting set of cards to play around with and as it is a new title those new to the genre will not be overwhelmed by the card pool like in other such games. The artwork and overall flavour are also strong points.

The actual mechanics take some of the core concepts of other games and add a few unqiue elements; the speed aspect of differant cards adds an interesting additional component to game decisions for example. The devs seem very eager to test new ideas and make changes based on feedback so this is also a big plus.

In terms of price which is often a real issue with games like this, spellweaver offers a really gentle entry level for most players. I was able to unlock 4 starters and get a good number of booster packs just by playing and learning the basics for free. After this the starter pack is a good first purchase if you like the game; between that and the extra boosters you get by playing and earning gold, for about £15 you will have enough cards to make a decent deck and start playing other people. £15 is a pretty low cost for so much entertainment so it is hard to fault the payment model as it stands. How much you spend therefore is up to you. You can probably do well at the game with what this gets you if you get the mechanics down and practice but to top the leader boards I would imagine you would have to fully optimize your deck and as with any game like this that could get expensive; for the average player a few purchases here and there will keep the game fun enough I suspect.

Apart from the points mentioned it is worth noting also that as this is a new game, those joining have the unique chance to watch the game develop from its first set as they themselves get better at the game which itself is an exciting prospect.

Recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198017203107', 'num_games_owned': 325, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 7006, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3488, 'last_played': 1530878934}
review:
Po przykrej informacji, że Duel Of Champions nie będzie już wspierany i umiera postanowiłem poszukać dla siebie drugiej gry karcianej na długi czas. W pewnym momencie natrafiłem na Spellweaver, komentarze były pochlebne a sama gra dość nowa i free2play więc czego by nie spróbować, zajmuje tylko 400MB ;) Pierwsze wrażenie to ładna grafika menu oraz samych kart. Samouczek wyjaśnia podstawy rozgrywki.

Mechanika jest połączeniem szybkoći Heartstonea, gospodarka maną podobna do Magic The Gathering, taktyka kojarzy się z Duel Of Champions. Gra łączy najlepsze cechy tych gier i wprowadza sporo od siebie. Czymś co odróżnia Spellweaver od reszty karcianek jest szybkość kart, maksymalnie mamy 4 stopnie szybkości danej karty (jednostki walczącej), gdy dysponujemy kartą o szybkości 2 nie będziemy w stanie zaatakować jednostki o szybkości 3. Wprowadza to utrudnienie do gry oraz dodaje nowe możliwości strategiczne. Aby wystawić daną karte potrzebujemy odpowiedniej liczby mana ale i levelu. Tak każda karta posiada wymóg ilości mana  ale dodatkowo level. Level i mane możemy zwiększyć za pomocą tzw. shrine czyli świątyń (odpowiednik landów w MTG) raz na turę z tym że musimy zdecydować czy zwiększamy level czy poziom many.

Mamy aż 6 frakcji różniących się stylem gry, jedne są nastawiane na szybką walkę ofensywną wystawiając jak najwięcej jednostek inne zaś kontrują zaklęcia przeciwnika i wracają jednostki z pola gry do ręki właściciela lub na cmentarz. Nie ma limitu jednostek w grze, ile sobie stworzymy/przyzwiemy tyle mamy na polu walki ;) Każdy odnajdzie tu swój styl gry.
 
Walka jest bardzo szybka i dynamiczna, w odróżnieniu od MTG atakujemy wrogiego bohatera ale nie stoi nic na przeszkodzie żeby zaatakować też wrogie jednostki. Możemy blokować i atakować dowolną ilością jednostek o ile mamy szybkość taką samą lub wyższą od wrogiej jednostki. MTG (Magic Duels) jest grą dość wolną, trzeba dużo czasu czekać na skończenie animacji co wydłuża rozgrywkę. Grając ze sztuczną SI na łatwym poziomie średni czas gry to ok 5 minut (moja najkrótsza to 2:04) ;) Z żywym graczem zajmuje około 8-15 minut. A więc można bardzo szybko farmić i zbierać złoto na kolejne pakiety kart. Jeśli chodzi o połączenie z innym graczem to nie ma tu jakichkolwiek problemów, jesteśmy łączeni średnio do 30tu sekund.

Pora wspomnieć o modelu mikropłatności jaki zastosowano w grze, gra na pewno nie jest pay2win, wszystko jesteśmy w stanie sobie ugrać i odblokować bez wykupowania kryształów które dostajemy za prawdziwą gotówkę (zupełne przeciwieństwo Hex: Shards Of Fate ;) ) Bywają zadania które dają 50 lub 100 sztuk takich kryształów. Możemy wydać to na pakiety lub opcjonalny rewers karty za 200 kryształów przypisany dla konkretnej frakcji lub 300 za wybrany dla dowolnej jeśli ktoś lubi się wyróżniać w tłumie ;) Na starcie mamy tylko jedną talię, kolejne odblokowujemy co piąty poziom własnego konta, oczywiście możemy odblokować wszystkie za złoto zdobywane w grze lub kryształy (gotówka lub zadania).
Codziennie dostajemy zadania a w nich nagrody: złoto, pakiety kart lub kryształy (rzadko) a więc jesteśmy w stanie dość szybko się wzbogacić o nowe karty. W talii możemy dobrać tylko 4 karty tego samego rodzaju jeśli mamy ich naddatek możemy zamienić je na shrine (świątynie) które stają się tutaj surowcem do wytwarzania kart. W grze istnieje crafting. Za określoną liczbę świątyń możemy stworzyć sobie kartę, wymóg jest różny, najtańsze karty kosztują 5 sztuk świątyń (powszechne) a najdroższe np. bohaterów (epickie) aż 150 sztuk świątyń. Zniszczenie jednej kary daje jedną świątynie. Istnieje opcja konwertowania ich z jednej frakcji do drugiej ale jest to nieopłacalne, za to co włożymy dostajemy mniej ;) Lepiej zbierać je do momentu aż zgromadzimy odpowiednią ilość poprzez ich niszczenie. Trzeba pamiętać że 20 jest zarezerwowanych dla talii i nie można ich zniszczyć.

Co do budowy talii to nie mamy żadnych ograniczeń jak wspomniałem wcześniej możemy użyć 4 kopi tej samej karty w talii, i tylko jednej karty unikatowej tego samego rodzaju. Ilość kart dostosowujemy do własnych preferencji, możemu łączyć frakcje jak tylko chcemy, nic tylko grać ;)

Jakieś minusy? W zasadzie ciężko mi takie znaleźć, uważam, że frakcje są dobrze wyważone, każda ma swojego Asa w rękawie, nie napotkałem na większe błędy, czasami tylko życie wrogiego bohatera wzrastało podczas gdy moja jednostka atakowała, po ataku wszystko naliczało się odpowiednio, zapewne błąd graficzny. Mogę się czepić jedynie dwóch rzeczy- jak jest oznaczona wyczerpana karta otóż pojawiają się nad nią zielone literki "Z" które z niej ulatują. Moim zdaniem powinni to zmieniać np. zastępując to dyskretnym znakiem "X" na całej karcie lub przyciemniając, było by to zdecydowanie lepiej widoczne. Drugi aspekt graficzny który troche kłuje w oczy to ikona kursora. Kursor w grze jest zupełnie taki sam jak domyślny w Windows, można by zaprojektować kursor dedykowany który pasowałby do klimatu gry ale to tylko moje zdanie ;)  

Podsumowując gra ma wielki potencjał turniejowy, jest szybka, nie próbuje nam otwierać portfela, cieszy oko. Twórcy obiecują cały czas ją rozwijać, dodawać nowe elementy i karty. Gra póki co jest jeszcze niszowa, nie ma reklamy i recenzji ale po wprowadzonych na dniach lokalizacjach może to ulegnie zmianie. Aż ciężko uwierzyć, że jest tak mało popularna :o
Ja polecam :D

UWAGA!!! GRA JEST PO POLSKU od wczoraj, w opisie gry nie jest to jeszcze uwzględnione ;)

review:
Gran TCG, de esos que huele a genialidad desde el principio.

Algunos lo están comparando con HS, pero Spellweaver le da mil vueltas, siendo sólo comparable a Magic por el sistema de maná, aunque para mí el de éste es mejor.

Todos los que hayáis jugado MTG os habrá pasado, una y mil veces, el no robar tierras en los dos o tres primeros turnos, jodiéndote toda la estrategia y pudiendo hacer bien poco por recuperarte. Que sí, que "es parte de la magia de MTG", hasta yo he dicho eso, pero por mucho que lo digas no deja de tocarte los cataplines x)
Spellweaver, aunque todavía con pocas cartas, te acerca mucho al sistema de MTG, pero con mejoras tanto en los combates como en el sistema de manás, para mí mucho más equilibrado, ya que te permite recuperarte aún con una mano mala, equlibrando la partida.
El tutorial podía ser algo más completo, pero para pillar los conceptos básicos está bien.
Con bastante posibilades al principo de conseguir rápido bastante cartas, y regalándote cada 5 niveles una baraja, hasta tener 4 (creo que eran) de las 6 barajas iniciales.

Un gran juego que deberían probar todos los que les gusten los TCG, porque éste promete muchísimo si sigue creciendo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042762008', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 6234, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2948, 'last_played': 1485706114}
review:
CCG classique qui se raproche plus de MTG que de Hearthstone.
La nouveauté du jeu c'est la notion de "speed/rapidité" présente sur les créatures. La "rapidité" régie le combat : qui peut attaquer qui, qui peut bloquer quoi. C'est la seule mécanique qui pourrait vous ralentir dans l'apprentissage de SpellWeaver.
Le "Free to Play" ne doit pas vous laisser dubitatif : <<On les connait les TCG/CCG f2p ... >>  Et bien là c'est une très bonne surprise parce que le système est très généreux. Il est même possible de récolter de la monnaie premium.
Les séances de farming ne durent pas plus de 25-30 min, ce qui est un gain de temps considérable comparé à un Magic : Duels ou encore un certain Hearthstone, tous deux Free to P[L]ay (hum hum)

Le jeu est jeune, la quantité de carte est limitée. Les joueurs restent attentifs aux décisions des développeurs. On attend la première extension qui viendra rajouter du contenu au jeu. Point important pour l'orientation du jeu.
A jouer tel quel.

review:
Карточная игра. Сделана великолепно!!! Захватила меня полностью. Красивые карточки. Найти бы еще перевод русский, трудно понимать, что какая карточка делает. 
Для тех, кто не знает, что такое карточная игра. Карты - это ваши герои, каждый со своими способностями, силой и количеством здоровья.  Выпадая из колоды в случайном порядке вносят разнообразие в игру. Нет единой стратегии, каждый раз на поле и в доступных картах разные комбинации.
Собирательство карточек вносит азарт в игру.

review:
Trading card game.
If you are familiar with trading card games this is easy to learn otherwise it might take a bit of time as the tutorial might be a bit of cryptic. Even if you are familiar with card games, Spellweaver brings something new to the table. Creature speed is a new concept for me and so is direct attack against creatures. First is nice addition the later one isn't.
Balancing would need a bit of working, some overpowered cards in the game atm. Game has potential

Pros:
- Free
- Creature quickness brings a new dimension to combat
- Nice graphics
- No need to spend money on.

Cons:
- Still too many crashes
- Would need a bit of balancing
- Not fan of direct attacks against creatures

author: {'steamid': '76561197996503472', 'num_games_owned': 966, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 15812, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15701, 'last_played': 1555999368}
review:
<sigh> It really pains me to write this, especially after I'd previously given this game such a glowing positive review, but... yeah, it happened again. A well-designed and entertaining game gets utterly mismanaged and completely screws the pooch until it dies an early death. Spellweaver has gone the same way as Might & Magic: Duel of Champions, Infinity Wars, Star Crusade, and basically every digital CCG that isn't Hearthstone.

Oh, I warned them. I [i]told[/i] them they needed to produce more expansions to keep the game fresh and the players engaged (I dunno why I needed to, that is literally CCG 101). I [i]warned[/i] them their stupid plan of releasing tiny monthly injections of cards into the game instead of single large releases was the worst of both worlds- not enough to keep the players excited and the meta shaken-up, just enough to annoy people and prevent the meta from even finding any kind of proper balance, and of course they weren't able to keep it up anyway ("monthly", yeah right). I [i]told[/i] them completely abandoning work on the PC version to focus on making a mobile version would be not only a waste of time (because Spellweaver is a much more in-depth and complicated game than the quick and simple Hearthstone, making it less-suited to playing on the go) but would disappoint their [i]existing[/i] player base in the name of pursuing the mythical "mobile market" that couldn't care less. They didn't listen. They never listen. And now the game is as good as dead. There's no community. There's no communication. There's no news. "Monthly" card releases are several months behind, as they have been ever since the system was implemented. They still hold regular tournaments, but these are almost always won by the same handful of players. It's tragic.

There isn't even any point talking about the game itself. Gameplay-wise, it's great. It's really deep and elaborate, one of the few CCGs that doesn't assume its players are idiots and allows them to do things like act on their opponent's turns. Aesthetically it looks good too, if a bit basic with the special effects- it has nice art and looks clean at least. Its monetisation model was good too, until they went for the stupid monthly mini-release thing. But it really doesn't matter, because the game is going nowhere. You can log in, you can even play, but why bother? Go look at the forums- it's been [i]months[/i] since anyone even so much as made a post. Yet [i]another[/i] promising and entertaining game succumbs to mismanagement. What a waste.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058170919', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 14318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2024, 'last_played': 1608494438}
review:
My my! This is a great surprise! I´ve played many card games already and Spellweaver is really growing up on me. Even I would dare to say that this game has much more potential than Magic Duels. Let´s see what this game offers:

- Fully flexible deck editor to create your deck as you want. I even made a 6 color deck, just saying... But there´s more. Heroes which belong to a specific faction can use any hero skills regardless the color. So you can imagine the possibilities...

- 6 factions.

- New mechanic to deal with. Speed.

-Trials which is a draft mode. Very interesting. Other games do not have this  like Magic Duels "Cough" "Cough"

- Initial card pool at the moment is limited but decent. However more cards will be added soon.

- 8 languages will be added too. Incluido Español chavales xD!! Asi que no hay excusa para no jugar.

- A very damm generous quest system. The rewards upon completing quests go from gold, to certain cards or who knows: boosters, crystals, epic cards. Just wow... Truly Amazing. Plus an academy feature that grants epic quests each 3 days.

- Crafting system. If you get repeated cards. Turn them into shrines. Stack those to craft for instance a hero card or any other epic one     

- An effective leaderboard in which you keep ascending to get better prizes.

Cons?... Are there cons in this game??? I haven´t see anything important really... But I suppose a game could keep improving so maybe I would say:

- Lacks some beautiful osts to enjoy the game ven more. MDOTP 2013 did greatly. Granted I admit it xd. I suppose Spellweaver could enhance this aspect later on.

Do I recommend this game? Hell yes!! I´ve been playing digital versions of Magic and I always hoped they could make a really good version fusing the good things in each one to deliver a good gaming experience. Did they? No they didn´t. Hearhstone? Its a good way to empty your wallet... So I began to wonder if a mix of Magic and Hearhstone could even exist. I don´t know if this is a miracle or what but yes a group people did it!! And it´s called Spellweaver! My dream come true! Thanks a lot devs <3 I love this game xD

What are you waiting for? Play already!! Free to download!! 
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Edited and unistalled:

I suppose everything in this life has a catch. And unfortunately, I found it... Now don´t get the wrong idea. The game is ok. And if you can allow the following 2 things... Sure go for it.

A) Yesterday I couldn´t longer resist the temptation. I wasn´t able to save more money and I burned all of it in boosters. How much? Near 350k gold. This is a total of 16 boosters more or less. Results? Only 1 epic, the rest garbage. Awesome... Now imagine someone had invested 350k gold using real money. Do you get where I am getting at? So, point A: annoying & unfair RNG when oppening boosters. Was expecting better cards? Absolutely! What the hell...! If there were boosters with a 75k price ensuring  like 3 random epic cards... I could reconsider. But that´s no the case. Why they offer you such "generous" rewards in quests? Exactly for that. You could spent 1.000.000.000.000 gold in boosters and get only repeated cards all the time. Even if I can use the Shrines... it´s not going to work with me... At least Magic Duels (even if its crappy) allows me to know that by some time I will have the collection unlocked.

B) The AI is a complete joke. When you play against hard AI you might encounter 3 different ones... One of them is the fair one, is challenging, sometimes you win and sometimes you don´t. Another one is an AI that stands still for no reason. So you actually manage to get an "empty win". And finally you can encounter an AI that even if the game is clear and can win it won´t. Instead it will torture you killing all your creatures until you have no more cards in deck.

Conclussion if you can ignore these 2 details... Sure play Spellweaver. I still recommend it beacuse... I suppose it was good while it lasted :( 

Sigh...

author: {'steamid': '76561197997788148', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 8182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2469, 'last_played': 1609436690}
review:
[h1] Price and fairness at online TCG[/h1]

i've been playing this now for a couple of hours, at first i tought "well one more money grab TCG"
you guys need first to understand that i played a lot of hearthstone, Magic Online and origins...
but after 5 hours playing spellweaver i was like..."man...this game...its totally not trying to milk me, thats so strange..."
i felt anoyed because i couldnt find the catch in it...like hearthstone you need to sink almost 400$ to get everycard, magic online ( lets skip it because it pass the 3000$ ) and magic origins you can sink some money or farm gold for it...
from a hearthstone player view, this game is so refreshing, i mean i can unlock cards by playing it while farming gold to unlock more cards or craft new ones, i got almost catatonic by the inumerous ways i can use to unlock new cards..comming from a game that i need to win 3 battles to get some spare gold + ridiculous ammounts of quest grind to get a few more, in just 10 hours of gameplay in spellweaver i was able to create one fairly good deck...full of new cards and some flair, while on hearthstone you need MONTHS of gameplay to get this lvl or sink a lot of money into it...

author: {'steamid': '76561198030250768', 'num_games_owned': 1125, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3867, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2939, 'last_played': 1459096100}
review:
É molto difficile che un gioco di carte possa emergere in un mercato quasi monopolizzato da Hearthstone e in parte da Magic, non è una questione di qualità ma di marketing, Hearthstone in particolare è molto giocato semplicemente perché va di moda giocarlo, Magic è l'alternativa se si vuole qualcosa di un tantino più complicato, ma qualitativamente c'è di meglio:

[list]
 [*] Spellweaver è un ottimo gioco di carte che unisce i pregi di Hearthstone e Magic senza copiare nulla

 [*] Offre un sacco di novità nelle meccaniche di gioco e molte abilità delle carte sono originali e mai viste.

 [*] Eroi e carte in generale sono bellissimi da vedere

 [*] Nessun limite nella quantità di Gold farmabile con le partite pve e pvp, più si gioca più Gold si guadagna, le quests sono molto generose ma hanno un limite giornaliero

 [*] Le classi sono 6 ma si possono creare mazzi misti con 2 o più classi, volendo anche un mazzo con tutte e 6 le classi, questo rende praticamente infinite le strategie di gioco, quindi niente mazzi tutti uguali ad alti livelli

 [*] Il gioco è nuovo e in crescita quindi se volete tentare la scalata ai Rank alti è ancora possibile senza spendere nulla 

[*] Non so se questo è per tutti un pregio ma... non è possibile "sfottere" l'avversario con frasette stupide e "finte" nelle azioni di gioco, insomma niente fastidi e distrazioni durante il pvp 
[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561198027635696', 'num_games_owned': 941, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1456772367}
review:
Antes de mais nada, sobre o jogo em si:
É um card game. Parece que HearthStone e Magic tiveram um bebê, este seria seu filho!
O game segue o modelo de HearthStone em sua maioria com alguns toques do que é apresentado em Magic e alguns - poucos - elementos próprios!
Tudo é muito bem colorido, as artes das cartas são bem desenhadas e os efeitos são bem bonitos também! Os sons são simples e as músicas são bem bonitas, mas como em todo Card Game acabam enjoando depois de umas horas!
Um ponto fraco seria a falta de se ter mais idiomas! Seus "pais" estão disponíveis em vários idiomas, inclusive com dublagens, coisa não presente aqui!
Outra coisa seria a carinha de Pay-to-Win, mas é Card Game... não podemos reclamar disso!
Não apresenta exatamente mecânicas novas, mas é uma variação a mais para quem procura uma nova experiência em Card Games ou já enjoou dos existentes Também é bom para quem quer algo mais fresco nesta área sem ter que aprender tudo de novo!

author: {'steamid': '76561198052077304', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1153, 'last_played': 1461661692}
review:
A very well implimented game. Very nice looking, and easy to learn. 

That being said, the game will cheat like a mother fucker durring challenges. Even the beginer challenges. The CPU opponent never has a random draw, its always a perfect draw. Unless youve spent a TON of time playing, or spent real cash for more powerful cards, dont bother attempting them. In all other ways, the game is decent. 

Its definitely a M:tG clone, with a small twist. Keywords are easy to learn, and impliment.

*Edit* after having played the game for a while now, I can not reccomend playing this game long term. Unless you plan to spend a LOAD of cash in the game, its not really for the idle casual player. You can not earn enough in game coin to augment your deck playing against the AI. Even if you get some of the quest sites unlocked the time requirements are a bit ... intense. A rare quest is roughly 13 friendly/ranked games. Even if you only play 10 mintue games (closer to 20 are more common) that will still take you over 2 hours for 2 cards. I also got a "mythic" quest. Its 200 for 12 packs. Thats over 30 hours at 10m a round. Its more like a full time job. 

Sure, youll get cards for doing things you were already going to do, but you will lose consistantly until you do. Its not incentive to play this game. 

To its credit, Ive seen some interesting ways to win, one deck didnt even use creatures. (Blue/Red copy fireball) But anyone who has predominate access to rare/legndary cards will routinely beat anyone with standard cards. They are MEASUREABLY better. 

TL:DR Pay to Win, but well implimented. Still no recomendation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057089194', 'num_games_owned': 347, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 2051, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 548, 'last_played': 1497347838}
review:
Spellweaver est un jeu de carte mélant des règles à la fois simple et complexe, il s'adapte donc à votre niveau de joueur et les combats contre l'IA vous permette de découvrir le jeu et progresser à votre rythme tout en gagnant de quoi vous acheter de nouvelles cartes. La stratégie est simple et efficace, les parties assez rapides et agréables et aucun déséquilibre apparant à l'heure d'aujourd'hui (29-12-16) entre les factions. La musique n'est pas trop chiante, le premium n'est pas trop aggressif. 

Les Plus :
-Combats contre l'IA pour s'entrainer tout en gagnant des récompenses. 
-Un jeu dynamique mélant une stratégie à la fois simple et complexe assez intuitive. 
-La cash shop n'est pas aggresive. 
-Pas de casse tête, mais un goût de défi. 
-Une faction d'Elfes et une faction de vampire. (Je plaisante pas, c'est ce qui m'a attiré comme cartes à collectionner...)
-Léger pour l'ordinateur et le disque dur.

Les moins : (points de vue personnel)
-Manque un peu le côté social pour jouer avec ses amis (enfin moi, j'en ai pas alors ...)
-Pas encore localisé en français. (Mais les capacités de chaques cartes sont assez simple à comprendre pour les non anglophones) 

Types de factions :
Elfes : Grâce au courage de vos soldats et à leurs stratégies, vous tiendrez coûte que coûte vos postitions. Faction facile à jouer, recommandée aux nouveaux joueurs. Très plaisante tactiquement.
Chevaliers: Envoyez vos hommes se battre pour la victoire ! Certaines cartes redonnent de la vie à votre héros. 
Mages : Des sorts et des créatures invoquées pour ceux qui savent s'en servir. 
Necromants : Invoquez une foule de créatures de leurs cryptes pour éradiquer toute vie chez l'adversaire. 
Elfes Noirs : Par la traitrise, l'échiquier est en place ... mais la stratégie se joue avec lenteur... Au pire, vampirisez la vie de votre adversaire, il n'en a pas besoin. Cette faction est délicate à jouer et il faudra compter sur une bonne pioche. 
Orcs : La technique des barbares, je fracasse je cause après reste une bonne stratégie... Au pire deux trois sorts si ceux d'en face ne se sont pas enfuient en courant. Faction facile à jouer, recommandée aux nouveaux joueurs bourrins qui aiment pas trop réfléchir car penser ça fait plus mal que taper. 

Je recommande donc, si les dévellopeurs continuent sur cette voie, on a un beau petit bijou !

author: {'steamid': '76561198067879455', 'num_games_owned': 469, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 734, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 557, 'last_played': 1502511963}
review:
Spellweaver take the best of other TCG and combine it into a whole different experience. It brilliantly took the best of it, combine it and modified it so became it own uniqueness. The most I loved from it is :

1. Shrine systems. There is 2 resource that count as mana, one is the level that is like MTG mana system. The other is Mana Crystal that is like Hearthstone one. There is Divine offering that let you shuffle one card in your hand for a chance to look top 5 of your library and took 1 shrine card.

2. Combat systems. With the involvement of speed, there is a 3rd stat for creature you need to look for. Lower speed creature cannot attack or block higher speed one. While in MTG, combat favor the defender and in Hearthstone combat favor the attacker. Spellweaver I think hit the sweet spot here.

Just try it and you know this is a good TCG.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997443234', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 5062, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2029, 'last_played': 1464950740}
review:
I liked the game, at least until I started playing Trials almost exclusively. Draft mode is the mode I have most fun playing in TCGs. At first I thought packs would be the entry to drafts in Spellweaver so I hoarded those playing with just the basic decks. Trials does have some issues though. It is more evident when playing Trials that previous experience with games such as MTG can be a bad thing. You do not have the option to respond to what your opponent does in the main phase before the combat. that can be frustrating, but it is not the reason for the thumbs down. 
The real issue is that some of the factions seem to have an advantage in this game mode. If you can get purple as one of the two factions you have a much greater chance of winning. Purple is beatable, but certainly have the advantage with fast cards and heroes with riddiculous powers. The raven hero in particular is just riddiculously bonkers compared to other heroes. Most people seem to have noticed this too, since I keep seing that one over and over, unfortunately on the wrong side of the gameboard... In constructed formats (Ranked/Friendly/PvE) it seems less of an issue. 
The game does have potential, and the draft mode is fun. But if you have the option to pick between two different heroes with the same faction combination, and a third with just one new faction it is not much of a choice.
Now what would make the game mode better? Maybe introducing neutral cards that require no faction level or where the faction level is just unspecified. Maybe the set of cards are balanced for one game mode and not the other? Some cards could be restricted/banned? Maybe a choice of three different faction combos would make things less forced?
Anyway, thumbs down for balance issues in the Trials/Draft gamemode.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042132152', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 26193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3101, 'last_played': 1630691260}
review:
This game combines the best aspects of Magic: The Gathering and Heathstone, plus adds original touches that make it stand out. Good game play with numerous deck strategies avaialable, and this is just with the basic set so far. The game play is pretty smooth and the UI is intuitive and looks great. The cards themselves also feature great artwork.

Most Free-to-play digital CCGs require you to dump some cash into the game or spend a ridiculous amount of time grinding to earn cards. Spellweaver is fairly generous with the availability of cards and in game gold used to buy packs, and the crafting system means you can get a couple of key cards you need for your ideal deck without relying on the randomness of opening packs. Very early on I had enough cards to tweak my starter, and in no time I was able to start constructing my own decks, which is the real meat of a CCG for me. I DID end up spending some money on the game, but that was more to support the game than to be competetive. And for those who want to support the game with out feeling like they're buying an advantage, you can buy cosmetic upgrades like card sleaves. I'm more inclined to spend money on games like this when I don't feel like I need to, and when the game is so good I want it to suceed.

Heroes start with a basic skill. You can add additional skills and choose your aspects as you wish (though your basic skill will require levels in your hero's native aspect). I particularly love the speed stat on creatures, which can make for some tricky decisions on when and how to attack, and the divine offering feature, that allows you to sacrifice a card in hand to get a chance at a shrine(these produce mana, skills, and aspect levels). Energy traits on cards also allow for some interesting mechanics (knowledge makes heavy use of these, though other aspects have it as well). You have multiple game options, from varying difficulty AI matches, friendly matches with human opponents, ranked matches to get on the leaderboard, tournaments, draft trials, and sometimes special PvE events as quests. However casual or serious you take your card gameing, Spellweaver has you covered.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993743050', 'num_games_owned': 128, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 14711, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2525, 'last_played': 1691502837}
review:
Игра, просто, 10 из 10! 

Есть один МИНУС неигрового характера: нет настройки разрешения экрана. Хотя у меня от фапа зрение опало, так что может не углядел, но вообщем не суть.....

Вот вы (игровое сообщество) тут (в интернете) разглагольствуете (кукарекаете) что раньше игры были лучше, сейчас говницо, души нет и так далее и тому подобное. Но ведь, что такое качественный игровой продукт - игра? Их есть две категории: 

Первая 
В игре всё сделанно на хорошо и отлично: 1)Программный код написан так как надо - минимум ошибок возникают при игровом процессе, минимум задержек, вообщем минимум (идеально редко встретишь) оплошностей с технической стороны продукта.

2)Проработанный дизайн уровней
3) Динамично развивающийся сюжет и/или игровой процесс
4)Нераздрожающий звуковойряд/ звуковые эффекты (как минимум)

 + Если есть ИИ то что бы не был полным идиотом.

вот эти 4 (5) фактора определяют хорошую и качественную игру! А всё остальное: "Ой графон не айс", "Стилистика не та" "Этот жанр говно" и т.д. и т.п. дело твоего вкуса (на который всем по хуй).

И вторая котегория: помимо, выше перечисленных аспектов, во вторую категорию ещё входит, так называймый, "WOW-эффект". Это может быть что угодно: Эпичная и красивая локация как в серии игр Бог войны или Тени Колоссов, это может быть сюжетный поворот "Вставь нужное название игры", появление нового офигевшего врага (врагов) как в Demon Souls и Divine Dvinity, новоя убийственная вундервафля в твоём арсенале как в DOOM или Крутом Сэме. Можешь дополнить этот список....     

Обычно на этом месте, большинство "обзорщиков" игр в стим извиняются перед читателем, что ушёл от темы, повествования, за отступление.... 

Да пошёл ты на хуй!

Вообщем: Spellweaver относится ко второй категории игр.  Ибо wow-эффект, в том, что разработчики смогли сделать карточную игру НАСТОЛЬКО МНОГОГРАННОЙ и ТАКТИЧЕСКОЙ (в плане боёвки) насколько это вообще возможно, Чего вообще не ожидаешь от игры такого жанра.

Музыкальное сопровождение, также, на высоте.

THANKS DEVELOPERS. GREAT GAME!

У меня всё.

author: {'steamid': '76561198145871719', 'num_games_owned': 7999, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1475631495}
review:
This game took me by surprise. I was never a fan of card games like this. I couldn't get into Magic, and Hearthstone was way at the back of the bus when it came to games I wanted to get around to playing at some point. 

This game caught my attention because of a promotion that the developers had to give you a "Gold Pack" which seemed to be a very nice head start for a new player. It was easy to get started, even if I did feel a bit overwhelmed at all the different types of cards and statistics that these cards have. 

I soldiered on and was surprised that I actually enjoyed the game. The mechanics, once understood, make the game easy to play. Gameplay is very well-balanced, and while I'm not usually in favor of microtransactions using real world currency to purchase in-game currency/items, I see that it is very possible to obtain all the decks and enjoy every aspect of the game without purchasing crystals, the in-game currency. 

There are a variety of characters, in the form of cards, and each has its own statistics indicating strengths and weaknesses. It's definitely a game of strategy, as much as it is the pursuit of the perfect deck. 

There's a lot to enjoy here, and I definitely recommend that everyone give it a try, certainly enthusiasts of card games, but even those who've never tried this genre before. You may just find a new obsession.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031189383', 'num_games_owned': 438, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 2095, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 822, 'last_played': 1458438871}
review: This is a magic the gathering clone with its own unique mechanics.  There are multiple card rarities, most notably Common, Uncommon, Rare, Extra Rare (as in magic) as well as legendary and epic.  Now obviously whoever gets the most epic cards wins, and it is pay to get lots of super rare cards.  In ranked play, as a new player, I was always egregiously outmatched.  However, the game is solid and solo play is alright.  But unless you invest massive cash and/or time, you won't be able to be competitive.  I can vouch, however, that I got a legendary card out of a regular pack that I earned by playing the game (say you get 1-2 packs an hour just playing the computer by doing quests.)  It's a real shame that in a ranked matched I wasn't facing people of same skill or inexperience or NOOBTARD deck power.  I'm not sure if that's because there was no one to face in the queue or if the ranked match is just that way.  <<Insert your usual "pay to win" complaint here for free game.>>  The tutorial could use some work.  There are several mechanics I see the computer using (who makes plays fast) that I have yet to figure out.  The only real gripe I have is the pay real money mechanic, but hey, it's a free game, so it's really player's choice.  At least there are things to do in here sans competitive play.  Oh, and there are 6 factions.  You pick 1 hero card for deck.  There are 18 hero cards, so I am guessing 2 for each faction and then 6 mixed faction cards, but I am not sure.  One thing is clear is that it will probably be VERY HARD to get the RAREST hero cards.  :(

author: {'steamid': '76561198061305151', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 16207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3949, 'last_played': 1492544066}
review:
Best digital card game out there. In fact, better than MTG itself. This game got it all right. I Played MTG for YEARS and now i can tell you that this game really got this better than anyone. 

ITS ALSO FREE TO PLAY, NOT PAY 2 WIN. 

Get cards on a daily basis, if you are a hardcore player, you will get many packs and drafts a day. Good reward system and really a community that is getting expanded really fast. 

There are still no "unbeatable" decks, and every player tries its best to build a nice deck.

You can mix the different Aspects (Colours) so you can allways think of a new way to play certain mechanic, or deceive your opponent in many different ways.

Really the card game i was waiting for.

Thank you Spellweaver developers and beta testers, all did a great job!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198195258951', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3566, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1848, 'last_played': 1463824885}
review:
Spellweaver is a cardgame that utilizes the good and fun mechanics from magic and hearthstone. 

You can expect to find hero characters and hero powers just like in hearthstone. The fighting mechanics resemble more to the Magic cardgame but with a twist. Your minions will have speed-points also referred to as SP, your minion can have a maximum of 4 SP and a minimum of 0 SP, a speed of zero means the creature cannot attack or defend! Which is an interesting mechanic to introduce into  card game! You will find many other surprising elements like ranged creatures, lifebound (this means that every damage dealt will give your hero life points), support creatures, flying and many more!

The rewarding system is something hearthstone could learn from, you gain gold when losing and it doesn't take much time until you gathered some legendary.
So if you want a bigger challenge than hearthstone and something different than magic, this game is for you!^^

One thing for the developers (and i'm probably going to put this on the forums if it isn't already): go on osx, ios and android.
You will reach more people
People are going to play this everyday and everywhere!
Many people have devices for windows and mac. 
You should be able to compile that shit for those platforms what's the hold up!?
Think about it :p

review: My immediate impression of this game was "oh no, another MTG rip off". But although there are noticeable similarities, it is a very different game. The only problem I have so far is server instability. I get disconnected a ton and this results in lost games. I cannot bring myself to invest any actual money into the game until I feel secure that it will not be wasted due to server instability. Aside from that. The quest/free to play system for earning your cards is nice and balanced. I am not sure why so many of these virtual card games do not include a trading aspect. Who cares if people start selling singles its just going to make your pack sales increase. Instead there is a decent crafting system, where you use your mana sources, similar to lands in MTG, as a currency to break down and create new cards. If you are a card game and strategy fan then I highly recommend giving this a go.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031362295', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1869, 'last_played': 1473819695}
review:
Overall this is a fun game. With a fair amount of time and effort you can get enough cards to tinker with. The mechanics are solid, a hybrid between Magic: The Gathering and Hearthstone. At no point do I feel pressured to play other people. I've amassed a pile of cards and I've only played against another person 3 times. I can relax, play against the AI, and tinker with my decks to my heart's content. 

There are problems though. The factions don't feel balanced. It's a common opinion that dominion and corruption are too strong compared to the other factions. Also, playing friendly matches is painfully slow. Part of the reason I like playing the AI over human opponents is because I don't want to wait at all.  Also, there are occasional server issues. I lose connectivity sometimes and get logged out. Some concepts could be better explained or cleaned up like crafting, but you'll eventually figure it out.

Overall it's fun and engaging. My brother thinks the way the battlefield flips up from the middle is stupid, but he's stupid and can shut the hell up because I'm having fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964574917', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 927, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 884, 'last_played': 1492291449}
review:
This game takes the core concepts of Magic: the Gathering and adds some interesting changes, namely by adding creature speed ratings and changing the core resource gain mechanic to help you cycle through your deck faster.  It works out really well.  Also, the item store aspect is not pushed on the player - much of what is there can be bought through in-game earned currency.  If you want to spend money, there are useful ways to do that, but it is not required.

Overall, I'm very happy with Spellweaver and look forward to playing it much more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032080413', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4513, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2968, 'last_played': 1594794387}
review: Spellweaver is a fun cardgame in the vein of MTG that should be held up as an example of freemium done right. As someone who previously didn't understand cardgames at all, this one hooked me right away. There's no ability to trade cards with oter players, but that seems to be because there's very little grinding, probably to make sure free players have a fair shake. Ultimately, spellweaver is fun as hell, whether you're into casual or competitive gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065553345', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 11604, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3697, 'last_played': 1473228761}
review:
Want a ccg that's more complex than Hearthstone and Cheaper than Magic Online?  This is it.
Pick Dominion first.

Spellweaver has many features that make it one of the best, if not the best digital ccg out now.  You can fully customize your deck, which is a great improvement over hearthstone where you're limited to only your class cards and neutral cards.  This is kept in check with their equivalent of magic's color system.  In Spellweaver there are two main resources: levels and mana.  Your deck consists of Shrines creatures and spells.  Spells and creatures are virtually the same as Magic or Hearthstone the shrines are what makes this game different.

Unlike hearthstone you don't get mana automatically every turn instead you can play a shrine which can give you a level in its particular discipline or a mana crystal and draw a card.  If you are low on shrines, you can use a once a turn ability to exchange a card from your hand to look for a shrine in the top 5 cards in your deck.  These features help prevent the problems magic has of mana flood or mana screw.

Gold accumulation is acceptable in this game and better than hearthstone I'd say.  You accumulate gold for all games you play as well as a bonus for going up player levels.  In addition to games and bonuses, there are also quests which can reward cards, packs, gold or sometimes crystals (the pay only currency).  The pack accumulation rate is about one for every thirteen ranked games won. (I've found I get about 1000 gold on average for winning a ranked game) and you get half gold if you lose, which is way better than hearthstone at one pack for every 30 wins.

Give it a download and try it.

Pick Dominion to start. (For magic players it has rampant growth, wrath of god, and mind control.

My recommended starter deck order:
1. Dominion
2. Wisdom
3. Corruption
4. Rage
5. Order
6. Nature

review:
This is the TCG that i have been looking for. It copied the best things from other TCGs and got it all in one place and thats awesome. When you combine all of that you get a unique game and feel that has everything a player needs, and I hope it will continue to evolve because it has the potential to be big.

6 aspects that you can combine is obviously taken from MTG and thats awesome because evry person can pick an aspect to their playstalye or combine more to make the perfect deck. Combining summoning cost of cards, number of same colored aspects and crystals  (I wont say they took that from heartstone because this game was in develop for 4 years and heartsont came our 2 years ago) really puts your brain to work how to combine and balance them out. For now pretty much 2-3 same colored aspects are enough (or i didnt see any cards that use more than 4 same colored aspecsts). So for new players its really easy to pick it up (tho you need to do some card reading and trying out to figure how the cards exactly work), and for some veteran TCG players they can go in depth big time. The hero powers and the menu/gold/fame and shop style are taken from Might and Magic Duel of Champions and imo its the best shop style. Want to buy cards? Play a lot and gain gold (gold gain is moderate not too quick or too slow). Wanna buy cards fast? Give real money, and thats more than fair because the game is free to play. I will at one point start buying packs just for the reason to support the game and not to get cards because they deserved every bit of it.

Edit: Just please if you get the time think about putting offline play. Playing vs bots getting gold and fame as it is. no quests or buying packs just playing with what you have vs bots.

review:
A really enjoyable collectable card game - as you have probably guessed, inspired by magic the gathering. Some have said that it's a blend of MTG and Hearthstone, and this is true, but it leans alot more on the MTG side of the table. As with MTG, you can cast "interrupt" type spells on your opponents turn, so this adds a layer of strategy that Hearthstone doesn't have. I also like the "speed" feature that creatures have - again - adding to the layers of strategy. I haven't quite mastered the game yet (only 10 hours into it), but so far its alot of fun

I've played several CCG's and this is near the top of my list. The devs are very generous with the gold and I feel as if I've gotten a ton of cards without spending anything, but am compelled to throw them some money to show support for this really nice game.

Essentially, if you are into CCG's, there's no reason not to try this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046945758', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 697, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 599, 'last_played': 1472315087}
review:
Jako zapalony gracz i fan papierowego Magic: The Gathering, muszę przyznać, że długo szukałem gry online, która choć trochę zbliżyłaby się jakością i złożonością do tej kultowej już karcianki. Póki co Spellweaver sprawuje się w tej roli rewelacyjnie! Animacje są świetne, grafiki na kartach również są wysokiej jakości i doskonale oddają klimat frakcji które reprezentują (tych jest aż sześć, i można je ze sobą łączyć, tak jak w Magicu), a rozgrywka sama w sobie jest wyborna.

Same karty nie są trudne do zdobycia, ponieważ złoto potrzebne na zakup boosterów zbiera się dośc szybko, wykonując różne zadania. W przypadku braku waluty, pozostaje crafting, dzięki któremu możemy pozbyć się zbędnych kart i tworzyć te, których nie mamy jeszcze w kolekcji (coś na kształt tego, który możemy znaleźć np. w Herathstone, tyle, że zamiast pyłu, używamy kart, które służą do podnoszenia naszych zasobów/many podczas potyczki). Okazuje się, ze to jedna z niewielu gier tego typu, w której tzw. Pay 2 Win nie istnieje.
Mechanika i synergia między kartami to prawdziwy "konik" Spellweavera, który pozwala poszaleć przy budowie talii i wytężyć szare komórki podczas rozgrywki. 
Dodam również, że muzyka jest doskonale skomponowana - klimaty folku-fantasy, okraszone przyjemnymi dźwiękami harfy, pozwalają zrelaksować się podczas potyczek oraz na ekranie głównym gry. Wreszcie coś, co nie drażni uszu podczas obmyślania taktyki, dzięki której uda się pokonać przeciwnika!
Tego właśnie szukałem!

Jak najbardziej polecam!
