author: {'steamid': '76561198068468068', 'num_games_owned': 269, 'num_reviews': 171, 'playtime_forever': 8758, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7822, 'last_played': 1470696299}
review:
EDIT: This review was made before I found Xmage and Faeria which I prefer.

This game is similar to MtG, and perhaps the most well-designed game of its kind, but sometimes suffers from its relatively low budget.



In MTG vs hearthstone, there are three major design differences: mana, combat, and instants. Spellweaver gets all of those points right:

1) Just like in MtG, lands are used to produce mana and you can have cards from multiple classes, but there is a lot more deck control in Spellweaver, so you very rarely run out of lands to place.

2) In Hearthstone the attacker would always choose who he attacks, and in Magic the defender would always decide. In Spellweaver, they have a speed stat for each creature, and higher speed creatures can block lower speed creatures; if they are not blocked they can attack whatever they want. It's a nice compromise that also adds some room for card diversity.

3) Instants exist in Spellweaver (and so add more depth to the game), but they don't slow the game down because they can only be played at certain times. So you get most of the depth of instants without having to pass priority after every card.



The game suffers a little from its low budget (the kickstarter only got $10k when the final goal was $15k, and it's made by a 5-man dev team that took 4 years to release it):

1) It's not too pretty. The card art is mediocre, worse than MtG or hearthstone imo. There are very few animations, i.e. if someone plays a card that says they instantly win you will only see the win screen, not how they won. The sounds are also fairly repetitive and lackluster.

2) You can't chat in-game. You can add friends and then chat after, but still.

3) The game has a pretty small playerbase, so they might stop developing it at some point... :/

review:
It took me a bit to get into Spellweaver but after I got the hang of the new TCG systems I was hooked. I like the idea of being able to shift creatures around and to break through the enemy lines with speed. Spellweaver takes the idea of strategy in a TCG and turns it up to 11 with having to manage speed, front line and support line, and order level. All of these new concepts combine to make each turn an opportunity to turn the tide of a match. Spellweaver is designed for the players who enjoy the strategic depth of classic MTG and the freedom of deckbuilding. 

Pros:
Charming Presentation
Tons of Strategy
Robust deckbuilding
Really good tutorial
Fair pay model
New concepts like speed, positioning, and order levels

Cons:
Limited player base
Balance issues
Small card pool

Spellweaver marries the depth and strategy of MTG to the charm and simplistic nature of Hearthstone to create a fun and unique take on the digital TCG genre.
 
If you want a quick look at the new concepts that Spellweaver adds to TCG genre then check out my video 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cPgPI_eXwl4&ab_channel=HammyD

author: {'steamid': '76561198070388404', 'num_games_owned': 155, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 841, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 794, 'last_played': 1467558198}
review:
Hearthstone and Magic the Gathering had a baby.. A really awesome baby.

The mechanics are similar to both titles and the card art is gorgeous. The free to play model is fair I find and I'll go into detail on that shortly.

As you play matches you earn gold (Free Earnable Currency) and fame (XP) You can play against AI or against other people and have the option of playing Friendly matches or Ranked games that give you a rating. All cards can be earned through just playing the game and it doesnt feel like your being drip fed a miniscule amount of currency to reach that goal of obtaining more cards and decks.

The deck Building is similar to Magic the Gathering in that you have multiple colours to choose from each with their own gimmicks and playstyles, You can mix them up how you see fit and create a customised deck suited to your playstyle.

Upon first entering the game you are given a choice of 1 of the 6 starter decks available (Which are still somewhat competitive against real people even without adding in cards earned through quests or buying with real money I might add)

Upon reaching level 5 (Roughly a couple hours of gameplay for me) You are given another starter deck and this is were the fun begins.. You can mix your two starter decks together to create a duo element deck as I touched on earlier.

For instance my Order deck (White token and flying focused for those that play MTG) and my newly acquired Nature deck (Elven Aggro which consists of low cost fast creatures and instant speed spells) were mixed together to create a deck that has more options instead of sticking to a set one trick pony strategy and allowing for more variation in what you can do in your player matches.

As you level up you will acquire Rewards for doing so, such as Gold and Packs you could otherwise purchase on the store.

Normal Packs contain 10 random cards and there are also good and evil Booster packs if your looking to get something from those specific factions. Good = Order,Nature and Wisdom/  Evil = Rage, Corruption and Dominion.

There is also a draft format with tournaments being held for prizes and these are unlocked later as you level.

Ranked matches are unlocked at level 3 giving you time to be eased into the game and learn its mechanics.

All in all I really recommend this game, It's free, Fun and you don't have to spend a penny to have a good time although if you want to support the devs I recommend purchasing a double box for either good or evil depending on the factions you want to play with.

This is easily my favourite card game as of now.. Yugioh, Pokemon, Hearthstone and Shadow Era (A f2p Card game similar to this) Havn't given me as much fun as this and I loved playing those games over the years.

Do yourself a favour, Download this 500mb Gem of a game and try it out for yourself, If your a fan of card games you wont be disappointed!

author: {'steamid': '76561198036379339', 'num_games_owned': 220, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 177, 'last_played': 1455736454}
review:
I'm really split on this one.
I like the art, the different factions, the innovations, the fact that you can mix and play multiple factions per deck.

But I really, REALLY hate the speed mechanic. The fact that the faction I chose, order, has mostly red / yellow speed creatures, means I lose every single combat unless I have a buff or trick. My opponent's creatures are unblockable and can attack/ block my creatures however they please.

The entire mechanic of speed completely wrecks this game for me. There is very little, if any, counterplay to fast creatures, atleast at lower levels. This mechanic alone made me uninstall the game.

This might 100% change later on, this might completely improve if I am willing to grind hard enough.
But I'm not.

review: Well designed, beautiful UI, and fairly balanced too. An interesting meld of MTG and Hearthstone with a few twists of its own, and pretty generous free-to-play rewards too makes it not a "pay-to-win" kind of scenario. CCG fans should definitely give this one a shot!

author: {'steamid': '76561198194191425', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 4226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1539, 'last_played': 1471853897}
review:
Spellweaver is, in my opinion, the best CCG out right now. I haven't had so much fun creating decks and challening players since the early years of Magic The Gathering. I currently have 8 pages worth of decks based around different ideas and synergies and it is only going to increase with the expansions! 

The Artwork is amazing and really pulls you in. The mechanics are innovative yet familiar, drawing the best features from games like Hearthstone and MTG yet improving upon them and making them distinct and original. 

There are top players from MMDoC and M:TG who play this game and it is great getting to see them on the leaderboards.

The quest and rewards system is VERY generous for a FTP, if you are an average player you can expect to build some very competitive decks within a few days of simple questing. If you are very skilled you can play Trials and probably get a full set in 3 months. Compare that to Hearthstone where it could take you over a year! While an amazing FTP game, I encourage everyone to take advantage of the 40% bonus crystals for the Steam release.

But perhaps the best part of this game is the Dev team; a small group of independant developers that really listen to the community and seem to constantly be working on and improving elements of the game based on player feedback. Their creativity is novel and exciting; just when you think a card is going to be fixed or nerfed in a predictable way, they surprise you with their innovative thinking. 

Believe me, after playing Spellweaver with it's Divine Offering mechanic, skill shrine abilities, hero powers and creature Speed mechanic, it is very difficult to go back to playing other CCGs. They have done the seeming impossible by minimizing RNG while maximizing deck variance. Definitely recommend playing this game if you are even slightly interested in CCGs (and even if you are not!)

author: {'steamid': '76561197994611296', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1455662628}
review:
The people who designed this game have absolutely 0% grasp of good game design, they actually managed to mash together the WORST features from several different card games and tries passing it off as enjoyable, when it's anything but.

Not only does it have the attrocious game mechanic where your summoned minions can attack other summoned minions directly, which just leads to horribly steamrolly games where a slight edge at any point in the game turns into way disproportionate board leads, they even had the bad taste to make damage heal after each turning, meaning that a player on the back foot doesn't even have the option of killing the winning players winning minion in a "death through a thousand cuts style", which would have at least been a slight upside. The game doesn't even contain anything that resembles decent removal cards, which I guess in their twisted logic is to compensate for the fact how effective removal the minions can be, but all this means is there are even fewer venues for comeback for a player on the back foot.

Furthermore, they even adopted Magic's style of having your scaling resource to play cards with be part of the deck itself, which means that you can fail to draw said resource. This kind of mechanic is fine for a paper card game as it is subject to physical limitations, but there is absolutely no excuse for a stand-alone digital card game working this way. None. Zip. Zero. This said, I realize they implemented an in-game mechanic to have a chance to draw extra "shrines" as they're called, but the fact that they felt compelled to add this arbitrary button to the game speaks volumes of how much of a bad idea the mechanic is.

Oh, and as an alternative to actually taking the time to design a decent AI they just give the "PvE" encounters that are supposed to be challenging ridiculous bonuses like starting with extra resources or cards, which like every time this kind of thing is pulled just amounts to playing something other than the actual game itself. It doesn't teach me or help the player in any way or form to transition into playing against real players and is honestly just always lazy game design.

Add to this that cards, and whole factions, are poorly balanced between each other and just a very poorly designed user interface in general leaves very little to nothing to make this game worth considering.

My advice is to stay away. Spend your time doing literally anything else.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029985509', 'num_games_owned': 425, 'num_reviews': 189, 'playtime_forever': 8313, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8092, 'last_played': 1461343348}
review:
This is a collectible, tactical and strategic, fantasy card game; a worthy successor to Magic: The Gathering ( M:TG ). This is a high quality game, in the same vein as "Spectromancer" ( free on Kongregate ) and "Infinity Wars".

"Spellweaver" features 4 different speed types for creatures ( think of a slow, lumbering giant or hydra that does massive damage, versus a swift elf that does lower damage - kind of like David versus Goliath ).

A lot of thought was put into overcoming mana problems. Lands ( shrines ) create both coloured and colourless mana, which become fixed, depending on your choice ( depending on the cards in your hand ). You also have the option to dump a card from your hand, draw 5 cards at random from your deck, and pick one land ( shrine ) if any - a mechanic that takes advantage of modern computing power.

Pros:

- Once you get over the learning curve of the game's speed mechanics, and timing of spells, the game becomes very absorbing.

- I love the artwork and the music is nice. My favourite card art:

https://www.dropbox.com/s/m0nfgc0upd0vpsm/Flash%20of%20Delerium.jpg?dl=0
https://www.dropbox.com/s/sx07j18fcenwxv5/Dreyla.jpg?dl=0
https://www.dropbox.com/s/jngm5xx4aip9f1d/Fae%20Of%20Charm.jpg?dl=0
https://www.dropbox.com/s/bmvctcx2rk360pz/Forcemage.jpg?dl=0
https://www.dropbox.com/s/0p1ol2jeaxiaxrq/Charged%20Aurite.jpg?dl=0
https://www.dropbox.com/s/qzyfg3yt49yef56/Mescatian%20Phoenix.jpg?dl=0
https://www.dropbox.com/s/w8zzhgm1ozj1vvu/ProtectorOfTheInnocent.jpg?dl=0

- The developers are very generous. You get a free booster deck every 5 levels, starting with level zero. By the time I was level 10, I had three different decks and made a couple of interesting dual-colour, combo decks. You can go on quests and gain gold and booster packs. Tips for beginners: buying "Normal" packs of 10 random cards for 12,500 gold is the best value for in-game money. In the beginning you might focus on good or evil packs but those cost 17,500 gold for 10 cards.

- You can practice against AI of different difficulties and they are somewhat Godly on Expert or Inhumane difficulty.

- I found a game at any time of day, even at 4:30 am ( North American Eastern time ) 1 minute queue time rather than 20 seconds, during peak time. If you don't want to wait, there is always AI. 

- Gets very addictive around level 5. I've been playing for 36+ hours straight. I passed out at my keyboard, min-maxing and re-designing my decks. I had just finished an "Epic Quest" ( 55 PVP battles ) and won a 12-pack box ( 12 x Normal Packs = 120 cards total ). Then I stumbled to the washroom before my pants filled up:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oNsMgl9KKIA

- I recently noticed that there is crafting ( to craft missing cards ) trials ( drafting ) and public tournaments. I just finished my first Trial ( a draft game against other human opponents ). The competition is top notch in Trials, which is fantastic. Two entry tickets were given to me for free by the developers, so based on my final performance ( 2 losses, 1 win and a final loss ) I ended up winning 2 x small packs + 1,000 gold.

Cons:

- The game mechanics regarding speed are confusing at first, so there is a bit of a learning curve, via trial and error.

- The card sets are currently tiny: around 31 different cards per colour. More cards are coming out in a few months.

- After playing for 36-48 hours straight, I got bored of seeing the same colours utilizing the same mechanics. I wish that there was a format for larger, pre-constructed decks ( I like to use 80- 100 dual-colour card decks. 100 card libraries are the maximum size and 60 cards are the minimum deck size ). Streamlined, 60 card decks are fun to make but they eventually get boring to play with or against. When I played Magic: The Gathering, my friends and I would use 2,000 card, rainbow libraries.

- The server is occasionally, annoyingly flaky giving you a, "You were disconnected from the server" errors ( usually a problem while trying to login to the game but a couple of times, I've been disconnected during a game ). If you were playing versus AI, the game state is saved. If you were playing versus a human, you have to try and login as soon as possible, otherwise the computer will pass your turn within seconds. The developers have been working on this game for 4 years, so it's a bit odd that this problem exists but I'm sure that given time, the problem will be rectified.

Spellweaver roadmap: https://spellweaver-tcg.com/roadmap/

review:
For the most part this is a stolen design concept game, From a TCG back in 2003, It seems to be a habit to try and revive old TGCs from the past and just doodle a new picture on the card and give it a new name, This wouldn't be so bad a thing if a little effort had been put in to BALANCE the game, Maybe this is a coincidence?.  However, I have to say I cannot recommend this game while there are so many stupid bugs and laughable decks as standard, The game ( like most ) has been filtered to ensure you will need to spend real money to have ANY chance of success against other players. Especially with the regular release of new cards

review: I've played a few really good card games online, this is not one of them. It's a decent game, just not great. Some of the cards seem broken from an entry level standpoint. If you don't have the counter in your hand the match is pretty much over as soon as they hit the board. The one thing they do right is not charge 2 dollars a pack for boosters. I'd say the game play is better than HS, worse than Hekz or IW. So bearing in mind that it's not good enough to pull me from what are IMO the two top tier tcg on the market I'm going to give it a thumbs down. Thumbs up for the F2P model though (not a complete cash grab).

author: {'steamid': '76561198040034300', 'num_games_owned': 442, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 18702, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2560, 'last_played': 1569365804}
review:
Игра очень понравилась интересными  решениями в механике. Любителям MtG точно понравится. Оформлена красиво, большая часть игры интуитивно усваивается с первых минут. Но, конечно, есть и минусы. Самый большой - маленькое количество игроков, из-за чего меня, игрока со стартовым наборорм регулярно отправляют сражаться с игроками, которые закидывают меня легендарками. Из плюсов - система приобретения бустеров дружелюбна к новичкам, да и в целом цены, в сравнении с другими подобными играми, доступные.
Игру однозначно советую попробовать. Ну и надеюсь на рост аудитории, а также на внимание разработчиков к балансу.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042764056', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 668, 'last_played': 1483266299}
review:
Я играл во многие разные ККИ. И в картонки, и в цифровые. Немало в Magic the Gathering, Hearthstone, Duel of champions, попробовал Yu-gi-oh, Infinity Wars, Берсерк, недавнего инди-Дуэлиста. Мотыга дорогая, черт ее возьми. На кухне конечно можно поиграть принтами. После того как HS наскучил, а Ubisoft прекратили разработку и поддержку Duel of champions я подсел на бету Spellweaver. 

Помню был баг позволяющий, накопить бесконечное количество голды. Ну заобузил, чтобы потестить все карты, создать побольше колод, которые придут в голову. С беты конечно очень сильно все изменилось, и надо сказать в лучшую сторону. Баланс лучше, графон получше (в бете были изображения с низким разрешением), вылетов меньше, сделали драфт (а-ля арена ХС), турниры. Если разработчики и дальше будут приклыдывать столько усилий, сколько сейчас, игру ждет весьма светлое будущее.

Плюсы:
-Механика (смесь МТГ и херкамня) + нововведения
-Не нужно донатить (вполне реально меньше, чем за неделю собрать топовую деку)
-Экономика и ежедневные квесты

Минусы:
-НЕТ РУССКОГО ЯЗЫКА. Наверняка скоро будет. Хотя для меня это вообще не проблема.
-Новичку и человеку не знакомому с механикой МТГ, наверно сразу не все понятно будет. Обучение не объясняет всех механик игры.
-Да, многие отмечают, что карт мало. Конечно, я согласен. Но и тех что есть, вполне пока хватает. Уже обещают новый сет карт. Очень хотелось бы, чтобы добавили двухцветные карты, как в МТГ.
-Мало народу днем. Хотя вечером поиск идет быстро. 
-Как следствие новичку иногда приходится играть со старичками из беты и его просто насилуют.


Актуальные свежие колоды можно посмотреть здесь http://www.spellweaverdb.com/
Также вступайте в группу вк, не стесняйтесь: https://vk.com/swccg

Итог: 8 Деспин из 10.

review:
Do you love TCGs? Then immediately come and play Spellweaver!

The game has a nice strategic depth thanks to interesting resource and combat systems. 

It's Free to Play and absolutely NOT Pay to Win, obviously you need a bit of a grind to get all the cards but the quest system is really generous (I dropped a few bucks anyway 'cause I'm impatient, plus I think good work should be rewarded)

The game is still young and has some issues, most notably sporadic server problems, a small card pool and IMHO card balancing still needs some refining, but I think devs are doing a good job and I trust they will improve the game more and more!

author: {'steamid': '76561198046607495', 'num_games_owned': 301, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 2607, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 807, 'last_played': 1498614208}
review:
+对不氪金的玩家很友好（每5级送一套牌组）
+目前游戏的卡池不深，但富含新意的规则和卡牌创造出了许多可能性
+游戏中卡牌的美术设计很赞
+规则上的诸多限制没有导致游戏乐趣下降，反而有了更多的思考空间，即使新手也可以快速了解游戏玩法
-服务器太屎。。。

游戏的大致规则和内容：
·和万智牌一样，游戏中召唤生物，使用魔法等等都需要魔力值，而除了魔力值之外，游戏中还有另外一种使用卡牌的必要条件，称之为“资源”或者“科技”吧，玩家使用“场地卡”提供魔力值或资源（一般情况下一回合只能选择增加一点魔力值或资源）

·先攻值：游戏中的生物卡有“先攻值”的概念（或者叫速度），速度低的怪兽无法攻击速度高的怪兽(很重要的一点)

·阻挡宣言：我方遭到进攻时，其他“未疲劳”并且速度大于等于进攻生物的我方生物可以进行阻挡宣言，即该生物可以代替被攻击的生物与进攻方的生物作战

·阵营：游戏中有六个阵营，分别用六种颜色区分，每个阵营的卡牌都必须使用本方阵营的场地卡提供的特定资源（魔力值通用），每个阵营的打法都不一样，比如说绿色阵营（精灵），其特点是生物速度快，但大多血少，不经打，或者是紫色阵营可以用各种手段加强己方生物，但需要谨慎地考虑其使用后果（有副作用。。。）

·多色牌组：游戏中支持不同阵营的卡牌组成一个卡组，因此根据个阵营间之间卡牌的特性，涌现出了各种有了许多奇♂怪的打法（2333），双色牌组甚至三色牌组都是可以的，即便是单色牌组也不会感到套路太少，因为就算是单色牌之间其组合也很多，可以研究很多套路

PS：游戏无中文，但是有英文基础的话大部分卡牌效果还是可以看懂的，如果看不懂贴吧有公式书供下载，里面有游戏的所有规则和所有卡牌的效果

刚进入游戏请先把两个教学关打完。。给的金币可以开卡包
之后建议先打打电脑，然后就可以开怼了233333

author: {'steamid': '76561198122083300', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 111386, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1139, 'last_played': 1705371286}
review:
After a few months of playing this game in open beta i can safely say that spellweaver is  my favourite ccg out there. 

(Someththing i have to say before the proper review. The artwork in this game = AMAAAZING)

People say it is a mix of mtg with hearthstone but in my opinion it is alot closer to mtg, except SPELLWEAVER IS BETTER!! 
       There's a "divine offering" tool that helps eliminate mana screw and even your basic shrines ( lands ) draw you a card which also helps.
       the combat system is unique to the genre where like in hearthstone you choose which creatures you want to attack but then the defender can also save his creatures by swapping them with any other creatures he has left over. the combat also has a front and support row and includes a new "speed" stat that creatures now have that all add strtegic depth to the gameplay.

There are plenty of things that you can buy but the game is in no way ,shape, or form a pay to win game. without paying a single cent on the game it is fairly easy to collect all the copies you need of every card in the game because it is so generous with quest rewards that range from gold to crystals to even getting your self a twelve pack box for playing ten games (A rare quest but by no means impossible to get) 

Just like other card games, every once in a while a card will appear or will have been buffed/changed and it will be the OP thing of the game that the community likes to hate on BUT UNLIKE other card games the awesome dev team that will as quickly as possible get to the root of the problem and will make changes to the card/ deck as quick as possible, (i mean like really really fast.)

This in the end has made an incredibly fun, strategic and balanced yet competitve ccg that any card game lover would be insane to miss out on. 10/10

((BONUS: The community is awesome and helpful, if your trying the game for the first time and have questions you should go to the spellweaver forums and say hi! I've yet to come across a single douche there.))

author: {'steamid': '76561197986747928', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 4773, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2880, 'last_played': 1610068490}
review:
I've been a Magic player on and off since Vth edition. I've also played Jyhad, some Netrunner, Infinity Wars, Hearthstone etc. I was looking for an online TCG that would satisfy me for a long while and I feel this could be it.

Spellweaver is not shallow when it comes to the gameplay itself. It feels a lot like Magic, but slightly different. It adds some depth here and there, while removing some of the aspects that make Magic seem complicated to beginners (such as the stack). The result is satisfying, it doesn't feel like the game or your deck plays itself like in some other TCGs, it never feels like RNG is determining the outcome of the game and although it's still early it feels like a good competitive scene could be built on this game.

The factions are interesting, with clear strengths and weaknesses as well as themes. The software itself is good and I haven't encoutered any major bugs. The occasional server problem still happens, but they usually don't last long and you can simply continue the match if it was interrupted. UI is clear and easy to use, although I'm not a fan of the separation of the Decks and Collection tab. Deckbuilder is not too bad either, but MODO's still my favorite. Animations are present, but short and unintrusive.

If you don't like the excessive simplicity of Hearthstone and aren't happy with the limitations and problems of Magic Duels, give this a try.  It's not a shoddy, poorly thought out card game like most online TCGs and it's not just a bland clone like HEX.

PS: you can't chat with your opponent, only with people on your friends list. Silly limitation and I find it hard to justify it, but I guess that's the trend now - playing online but without human interaction. Shame.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006743563', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1208, 'last_played': 1454888967}
review:
Here's about the best thing to say about the game. The devs really, really, really tried to do something different in TCG's. Unfortunately, they failed horribly. Why? Read on.

1. The biggest culprit is the speed system. Unlike every other game on the planet, your cards can't attack every other card. There are 4 speeds in the game, and each speed can attack their speed rating or lower, never ever higher though. The devs list this as a plus because they counter-balance it by making the heavy hitters slow while the fast units won't do that much damage. Here's the problem. They do a lot of damage, and they're cheaper than the heavy hitters. You also have the usual pump spells to make them do a lot more. So, you're going to gravitate towards the decks that have a bunch of them (Nature, Order, and Vampire/Purple).

2. "But if I survive and get my big creatures down, I'll still win." WRONG! Here's where the speed system really, really falls apart. Say I have 2 4/4 units that are speed 1, and you have 4 speed 2 units. My 2 4/4's can only attack your hero. This means I get to gang up on your unit and kill it once you attack, or I can just put one unit to chump block it. "Well, I'll just wait and block your squishy units and dominate the field." Nope. You can't block any of my units because they're faster. Wait, it gets worse.

3. Okay, I'll just play speed 2 units (what most of the units are btw). Then it comes down to who gets to buff their creatures first AND attacks first. See, if the units are the same speed, the attacker dominates. Why? Well, they get to pick which creature they attack, and unless you have a unit with a higher speed than the attacking unit, you can't switch defenders EVEN IF THEY'RE THE SAME SPEED. So, say you've buffed your units and can eliminate the opponent's units next turn. Ha! You're a turn too late. They attack your guys in the only way you lose everyone instead of wiping them all out. So, you get to watch your troops get slaughtered and can do nothing. Frustrated yet?

4. The Trial system is exactly as horrible as the Arena system in Hearthstone was. You get all the lousy rares/epics to choose from while your three opponents (same 3 loss system) have as close to a constructed deck as possible. Yep, it is just so much fun to see your deck that took 10-15 minutes to build and cost 17.500 gold or a ticket get waxed in 8 turns. Plus, you're required to play 2 colors, and you're randomly assigned them. With a few colors just being way worse than others, you could be screwed from the start, or face someone that got two of the best colors. Ugh.

5. The rarity system needs work. There are just some rares that will never hit the board. Why? They cost too freaking much. One of the best things the devs did is make it that every single time you play a "land" for mana, you draw a card. If you play it for a crystal though, you don't draw a card. That means you want to play only 2 crystals max. Great, let's look at the rares. Oh look, 3 crystals, 3, 3, FOUR, 3, 3, 3, etc. Granted, some of the 3's are very good, but there are only a few colors that have card draw seperate from just playing mana. That also tips some of the decks from good to great and mediocre to bad. If the rares cost like 8 mana and 2 crystals, that would be infinitely better than 5 mana and 3 crystals.

6. This is something that you'd think would be a positive, but it is going to end the game. You don't need to ever spend money on the game. It is truly F2P. The AI in the PvE part are just horrible to the point that you'll win with even the lousy colors. Play on hard, and you get 500 or so gold per fight. Combine that with the free daily quests you get to choose between, and you could get a 10-card pack per day easily without ever facing a human. And you really don't want to.

7. Why? Well, because the beta players will wipe the floor with you. They have all the cards and know the game inside and out. There isn't a huge player base meaning you're more likely to run into them. And if you are starting with one of the lousy colors, you'll get really wiped fast. Certain decks can hold their own if you luck into the right good rares.

8. The card base is way too small right now. You'll have 3-4 of every non-rare/epic by the time you reach level 10. Again, no reason to ever spend money. The game itself gives you almost every rare from just completing the 3 starter quests per color.

Again, they tried very hard to bring something new to TCG's, but it just didn't work. With it really being F2P, I can't imagine they will have enough capital to keep the servers running for long. They were already having server issues that they had to fix. If you want a TCG that either has no challenge or brutal difficulty that you don't have to spend any money on, this game is for you until the servers go down from no one spending any money. Otherwise, find a different game.

Note: This is someone that beta tested Hearthstone and played MTG for over a decade building all my own decks. I wouldn't call myself an expert at TCG's, but I'm not a novice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035182410', 'num_games_owned': 1144, 'num_reviews': 372, 'playtime_forever': 6826, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6826, 'last_played': 1491329546}
review:
Did you play MTG or Hearthstone? This game is basically a child of the two that didn't inhert any of their gen-defects. 
Hearthstone is an unenjoyable RNG and aggro mess, where as MTG feels cluncky and slow (especially MTG online, I mean Jesus fucking Christ)

If you have ever played MTG or HS you will find this game really easy to learn and fun to play!

(Edit: They changed the f2p model and make now expansions and content behind pay walls. You can still craft any card in the game as far as I am aware but crafting is a wasteful prozess and not as easy as just using ingame gold. As such the fairness of the f2p has suffered quite a bit and is the main reason I quit playing like a year ago. So take the rest that I wrote below 3 years ago with a grain of salt:) 

To the F2p model: I played since closed beta (both Spellweaver and HS) and I had a full collection in Spellweaver after about 500 games where as in HS I still don't have all the cards. You get about 4 times as much money from winning games as you would in Hearthstone and that is not counting in that you get money for lost games or the dozens of quests you get daily. 

All this game currently doesn't have is a large playerbase (500 are online at the same time currently) But that is a problem YOU can fix. Stop reading and play the game already!

author: {'steamid': '76561198059948329', 'num_games_owned': 1451, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 6632, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2707, 'last_played': 1610167733}
review:
可能是近几年最优秀的电子TCG之一。
6色种族可混搭、地牌提供资源、双资源池、英雄选择与英雄技能、双线战场、阻挡机制、类似炉石竞技场的Trials赛制、传统TCG的瑞士轮赛制、酷似炉石的分解合成系统和UI。在这个游戏中你好像能同时看到万智牌、冠军对决、炉石的影子。
但又不止于此。富有创意的速度值机制足以令人眼前一亮、弃牌换地与地牌抽卡的防卡手机制相比万智牌更人性化。还有诸多细节，可自行游玩体会。
卡池不深，但战术组合足够丰富。
对无氪玩家很友好（可能是对一般玩家而言最大的优点）。
唯一的缺点是服务器可能不太稳定，另外玩的人不多。

author: {'steamid': '76561198141353134', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 10432, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5468, 'last_played': 1521264089}
review:
This game's awesome. It's still in beta but I expect a lot of it.

If you are into TCGs you'll be fine with combat (some how like M:TG) and at the same time it'll present new some few mechanics (the support line, atacking directly a creature, and the speed system) wich will impress you. But I'll explain they later.
If you're not, I can say it's a easy going game, with intuitive interfaces and an explanation of every creature/spell's abilities/keywords whenever you click it.

As for now, every card is available through in-game progress. I've read that is not that hard to get all cards for free, but i dont know about future expansions card's quantity/frequency. I've bought some boosters with real money because I'm suportive and as said I think it's a promising game (actually, that's because I'm a lazy anxious bastard).

As for the mechanics:
I really don't know if there was anything like that before, but it's new to me: the speed system.
Basically every creature has another status besides Attack and Health, and creatures with given Speed status cant block or attack other with higher ones.
And there's the support line, where creatures can't engage combat (neither be targeted by another atacing one), and to where you can move creatures freely by the cost of the "summon sickness" when returning to front line.
Those mechanics combined make the combat much more strategic and thought provoking.

review:
Boring game, no turn timer unless you play ranked 15 mins max matchs, (were everyone will wipe the floor with you  because there wasnt a server reset and they own  all the cards already) you are looking at a 45 minute match to get a win against a sore loser, only 2 decks are viable and... you guessed, they are the only 2 decks you are going to find over and over, this game is just like solforge. 
Dont bother thinking the devs are going to add turn timers or balance, their meta is to release this game on IOS/Android so no drastic changes will be done at least  6 months from now. 

Save yourself the trouble, install and play Duelyst.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030617877', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1989, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1181, 'last_played': 1460083982}
review:
At first I didn't like this game. I thought it was too slow to gain gold, and it would be yet another Pay2Win game.

But I gave it a chance, and I've come to realize a major difference between this TCG and others - I actually enjoy the gameplay. It's not just another TCG that is about collecting cards and building a deck. You need strategy and tactics in game, and your deck needs to have multiple ways to play to be successful. You don't just sit there collecting cards and hoping you draw your iWin cards in game.

If you like card games with a lot of strategy and depth, I would definitely recommend it.

As for my first concern, that gold gain was slow, it does get better. Each starter deck you get (every 5 levels) unlocks a new quest zone which gives regular quests for extra rewards. And as you level, you also unlock more rewarding ways to play. Playing against humans does give much better rewards than playing against AI, however I find the game play vs humans is not bad... Trials game mode ensures everyone has the same chance at drafting a good deck and doing well, and so far in regular PvP I have not encountered any overpowering decks. Strategy, Tactics, and I suppose a little luck is what wins games, not lots of legendary cards.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095917598', 'num_games_owned': 498, 'num_reviews': 1815, 'playtime_forever': 4050, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1688307891}
review:
Fala pessoal, vamos dar uma Analisada no Spellweaver!

DL;DR

Spellweaver é um jogo com grandes influências do famoso Magic: The Gathering, e possui diversos elementos que marcam a essência do jogo.
Existem diversos elementos contando com: Order (Brancas) Wisdom (Azul) Nature (Verde) Rage (Vermelho) e Magias negras. Cada tipo de elemento
possui suas características específicas e uma diveridade de modelos de criatura e efeitos, gerando diversas possibilidades para criação de Deck.
O jogo também te providência alguns starter-decks para você testar qual deles você gostara mais, que podem ser obtidos jogando algumas partidas.

Se você é fã de Magic the Gathering/Heartstone você tem testar esse jogo! Recomendo !!!

Pontos Positivos:

* Grande semelhança ao Magic.
* Base de cartas bem elaboradas, possibilitanto diversos tipos de deck's diferentes.
* Recursos novos, como velocidade da criatura, que geram mais desafios a mesa.

Pontos Negativos:

* Devido ao número de jogos de TCG atuais, talvez ele não seja um jogo que ira te tomar muito tempo
* Como todo Card-Game, jogadores que investem dinheiro real no jogo recebem uma grande vantagem sobre outros jogadores.

Caso queiram dar uma olhada no jogo, segue a análise comentada! https://youtu.be/YmRzeen4S9Y  One of the most addicting online card games over there.
The game unite the best of Magic: The gathering and Heartstone, adding a personal touch to it. Card art is beautifull. Its fun, matchs are 15~25 min long, a quest sisten with nice rewards and it's not pay to win, You should defineteli give ir a try.  Playing this since closed beta.

Tl'dr; It's a great card game, and if you are fan of MTG, HS, HEX you should definitely try this game.

PROS
Easy to obtain cards:
You get starter deck of your choice for free.
Every 5 player level you can unlock more starter decks for total of 6.
You can obtain in game gold by playing in any mode either vs AI or real players.
You don't have to win to earn gold or complete certain quests.
By doing quest and unlocking more quest areas you can obtain even gold, premium currency, packs, cards. More rare quests even give entire booster boxes for free.
You can craft cards.
Unique game mechanics:
Speed - cards can only attack other cards that are same speed or slower.
Divine Offering - each turn you can replace one card in hand for chance to look at top 5 cards to get shrine. So this decreases chances to get mana screwed.
Multiple game modes: AI, Friendly, Ranked Ladder, Tournaments, Trials (Draft).
6 Factions with unique cards.
You are not restricted to single faction and can mix their cards whatever you want.
Classic card game experience, no digital only BS :D
Fast gameplay without annoying prompts every second.
You can use certain cards on opponent’s turn and can choose what blocks what.
Easy and simple to use interface.
In game tournaments.
Normal and Tournament Spectator modes.


CONS
Not many cards yet. 

Awesome CCG. From my experience playing the other card games, its the best among hearthstone, infinity wars, hex, war of omens, cards and castles and shadow era for the free to play casual player.

Pros
-Generous with rewards. Best f2p business model I have seen.
-Very few "useless" cards. Most of them are balanced and playable. You will not find a War Golem<<< Dr Boom scenario here.
-Card pool is still small so you can acquire them fast (took me about 2 months in closed beta to obtain an almost full collection). 
-Unique gameplay mechanics with good balance. Devs always listen to the community and strive to fix broken cards.
-Strategic and deep with minimal RNG.

Cons
-Slightly steep learning curve
-Small but growing playerbase
-Most of the starter decks are weak. Do not buy more than 1-2 of these as you get them every 5 levels anyway.
-Trials (sealed format) take too long and are not very rewarding if you cannot average at least 4-5 wins per run. Stay away from this mode until you have a better understanding of the game.
-Game is still slightly buggy.

End Score 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198057505132', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 18988, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1270, 'last_played': 1687552114}
review:
Sans être un grand spécialiste de ce genre de jeux, je trouve SpellWeaver facile à prendre en main.
Le jeu en est à ses débuts et vous avez pas mal de possibilités de deck à constuire avec les 222 cartes disponibles actuellement.
La particularité principale de Spellweaver vient de son système de vitesse pour ses créatures allant de 1 à 4. Ainsi, si l'adversaire attaque votre héro avec une créature disposant d'une vitesse de 4, vous ne pourrez pas la bloquer si vos créatures sur le plateau ont des vitesses inférieures (de 1 à 3 donc). Rien que ce point là donne une identité stratégique à Spellweaver.
Beaucoup de spécialistes parlent d'un savant mélange entre Magic The Gathering et HeartStone sauf qu'il est très orienté Free to Play et non Pay To Win car il est assez "facile" d'acquérir toutes les cartes en 4 exemplaires.
Pour ceux qui galèrent avec l'Anglais, une traduction fraaaaaaaaaaançaaaaaaaise est en préparation depuis un petit bout de temps et va donc arriver sous peu.
Et en plus, il est gratuit.....

review:
Most important of all : definitely not pay to win card game !
You can progress fast if you are a bit intelligent.

First of all - you search for a bonus redeem code that can give you gold or another bonus.
And no surprise - 100 000 gold code for game release celebration at multiple place. You active him - it's 10 euro value
You get a smart starter deck (he's free) searching in google : Spellweaver - Which starter deck should I choose? It takes 20-30 min before you start.

So you have a smart pick of easy deck and 100 000 gold. Buying full pack , getting some good cards , got 2 heroes and 2 epic cards - Nice.
What to do next ? Well let's spy and see some great decks build by hardcore players - searching google again.
1-2 hours pass - you find a cheap deck- going crafting - destroy your 2-3 legendary cards and buy 12-15 common usefull fillers at his place. So with 3 hours preparation , after 10 hours playing I had like 90% win ratio against low level not so informed new players that probably cry "another pay to win card game , stupid game bla bla bla" but in general it's only his fault that they waste his time without an idea what to do.

Well it's a long duel game , more like chess than 5-7 min hearthstone battle. If you have time 15-20 min for a duel and you want to think a bit you will like the game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198047809590', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1748, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1192, 'last_played': 1474281438}
review:
Ta gra potrzebuje jakiejś polskiej recenzji!
Zrażony zbytnią prostotą, i brakiem balansu w HearthStone, od dłuższego czasu szukałem porządnej sieciowej karcianki, która przy okazji bezproblemowo działałby na moim drewnianym komputerze. Skuszony pozytywnymi opiniami sięgnąłem po Spellweaver, i śmiało mogę stwierdzić, że to jedna z najlepszych komputerowych karcianek w jakie grałem. Wersja tl;dr recenzji na samym dole.

[h1]Mechanika oraz gameplay[/h1]
Pomijając kilka innowacji fani Magic the Gathering powinni poczuć się tutaj jak w domu. Do naszej dyspozycji bowiem oddano karty potworów, artefaktów, czarów oraz znane z wcześniej wspomnianego MtG Instanty - możliwe do zagrania w niemalże każdej chwili(nawet podczas tury przeciwnika) zaklęcia, które nierzadko potrafią zupełnie zmienić przebieg rozgrywki. Lekką, aczkolwiek znaczącą zmianą w stosunku do Magica jest system Shrines, które niczym Landy dają nam surowce. Ku mojemu zdziwieniu, nie pozostają one jednak na stole na stałe, a dają nam wybór między zwiększeniem ilości uniwersalnej many, lub dodaniem jednego aspektu zależnego od koloru danego Shrine. Owe aspekty, to nic innego jak kolory znane z MtG, jednak w przypadku Spellweaver jest ich nie pięć, a sześć, podzielonych w dodatku na frakcje dobrą i złą. Defensywny Order, świetny do control decków Wisdom, agresywne Nature i Rage, oraz mroczne Corruption i Dominion. Plusem jest możliwość tworzenia wielu kolorowych decków, czego pozbawiony jest chociażby wcześniej wspomniany HearthStone.
Kolejną zmianą w stosunku do Magic the Gathering są bohaterowie, ich mechanika jest podobna do tej z HearthStone. Poza byciem wyznacznikiem naszego HP, bohaterowie posiadają również jedno zaklęcie specjalne, z własnym kosztem i cooldownem, oraz 2 sloty na nowe zaklęcia, które możemy aktywować odpowiednimi kartami podczas rozgrywki.
Natomiast już kompletną nowością w mechanice jest, jakby zaczerpnięta z Might & Magic: Duel of Champions, linia supportowa, z której jednostki nie mogą być atakowane, ale i same nie mogą atakować, chyba, że wyposażone są w umiejętność Flying. No i nie mógłbym zapomnieć o autorskim systemie Szybkości. Każda jednostka bowiem posiada swoją ustaloną liczbą od 1 do 4 szybkość, która uniemożliwia atakowanie czy też blokowanie jednostek szybszych od siebie.

[h1]Oprawa[/h1]
Oprawa w grze, jak na tak małe wymagania jest naprawdę dobra. 3D plansza co prawda nie jest interaktywna tak jak w HearthStone, ale nadrabia to animacjami podczas fazy ataku. Animacjami, swoją drogą, niemalże żywcem wyjętymi w komputerowych Magiców. Efekty są proste, ale przyjemne do oglądania, a całość wzbogaca piękna, świetnie oddająca fantastyczny klimat muzyka. Muszę oczywiście wspomnieć o grafikach kart, ich autorzy wykonali kawał dobrej roboty! Podobnie jak muzyka świetnie oddają fantastyczny klimat przedstawionego świata.

[h1]Płatności[/h1]
Spellweaver wydany został w systemie Free To Play, a jak wiadomo, nie zawsze musi to oznaczać rzeczywiście uczciwą rozgrywkę. Na szczęście twórcy gry wiedzieli, w którym momencie się zatrzymać przez co gra jest przyjemna nawet jeżeli ktoś nie wydaje w niej żadnych pieniędzy. Boostery w grze możemy kupować za złoto, lub płatne realną gotówką kryształy. Przyrost złota jest jednak stosunkowo szybki, szczególnie, że możemy je zdobywać również na wykonywanie wybranych questów. Questy, poza dodatkowym złotem, nierzadko mogą nas również wynagrodzić kilkoma darmowymi boosterami, lub rzadkimi kartami. Same boostery natomiast, są dostępne w wersji tańszej, oraz droższej dającej nam dwa razy więcej kart. Poza tym kupując droższą wersję możemy wybrać, czy chcemy dostać karty z kolorów "dobrych" czy "złych" co jest bardzo przydatne, kiedy poszukujemy konkretnych kart. Oprócz tego w grze znajduje się system craftingu, jednakże jest on reprezentowany nie przez dodatkowy surowiec pokroju Pyłu z HearthStone, a wcześniej wspomniane Shrines, których odpowiednią ilość możemy przerobić na nowe karty.

[h1]Podsumowanie[/h1]
Spellweaver, jak na grę stosunkowo nową na rynku, póki co prezentuje sobą świetny poziom. Dynamiczna, ale nie pozbawiona głębszej strategii rozgrywka, powinna przypaść do gustu każdemu, dla kogo HearthStone jest zbyt prosty. Poza tym uczciwy system F2P, i starający się trzymać dobry kontakt z graczami twórcy sprawiają, że z całego serca życzę Spellweaver sukcesu na miarę HearthStone'a.

[h1]TL;DR[/h1]
[b]Plusy:[/b]
- Dynamiczny gameplay...
- ...wymagający jednak przemyślanej strategii
- Wiele typów kart
- 6 frakcji...
- ...z możliwością dowolnego ich mieszania
- Uczciwe F2P
- Questy przyspieszające zdobywanie kart i złota
- Ładna grafika i klimatyczna muzyka
- Twórcom zależy na kontakcie z graczami

[b]Minusy:[/b]
- Póki co stosunkowo niewielka ilość kart.
- Mogą zdarzyć się drobne bugi i glitche.
- Niezbyt rozwinięte funkcje społecznościowe.

review:
EDIT: Tried a few hours more and disliked it even more.......from my point of view it is a boring game.....a match lasts unsually for about ten minutes.....and they always felt like hours....no heartbeat at all.....the gameplay is very slow compared to HS or Duelyst....but you rarely see a close match.....either you win very high or loose in the same way, because your defence broke down.....

RNG: The draw system is bad, at least compared to duelyst......you cannot replace single cards from your draw (or later from your hand), but have to draw again, which often leads to the result, that you are even more doomed........

Pay2Win: You can play for free and you can obtain all cards just by playing......BUT: It´s much faster if you pay AND you can buy premium memberships which offer you many free booster packs a week........so it´s a two class society...........




Old Review:

Played during open beta and tried it again after release: From the point of view of an average Casual Gamer, I cannot recommend this game at it´s current state. It´s something for hardcore TCG/CCG – Gamers, who like to design their deck for months and who are willing to invest all of their leisure time or tons of their money. Progress takes a lot of time in the beginning and therefore the game feels very sluggish. So if you don´t have the time to grind the same quests over and over again, you have to buy expensive packs with real money. Veterans from the Beta always tell how rewarding this game gets later on, but I guess most of the Casuals will not get that far. 

Those who are looking for a better “Hearthstone” will be disappointed, because this game is closer to the much more complicated MTG and therefore less accessible than Blizzards counterpart. Instead of a straight gameplay with clear rules you get complicated mechanism, which take very long to see through and to understand.  The Meta also seems to be broken at it´s current state: Only a few decks are dominating and you can forget about the rest......it´s a pitty; maybe the latest changes will solve this issue.

Nevertheless the game offers a nice design and a team of developers who are willing to listen to the community and improve the game. So I guess, that the game will be worth another try in a few months, if it still exists.

What remains is yet another TCG/CCG without the special thing to distinguish it from the mass.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964702183', 'num_games_owned': 624, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 1471, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1465, 'last_played': 1498420642}
review:
I haven't played a lot but so far I have enjoyed it. 

I'm a former MTG player, play Hearthstone casually and am an avid fan of deckbuilder games. These days I prefer games like Smash Up, Munchkin and other similar games where you can buy a box and have a complete game with optional expansions instead of being forced to continually throw money at a game to remain relevant ala MTG.

The card artwork is really great and reminiscent of MTG, although the general game graphics/animations/interface are a bit bland.

If you have played either Hearthstone, MTG or both then Spellweaver should be fairly simple to pick up.

You will have a bit of a grind starting out as a free player. What gold you get you should spend on normal packs as you can unlock starter decks through leveling, which is done simply by playing games against the AI or both ranked and non-ranked games against other players. You get a free starter deck when you first play and unlock a free starter every 5 levels. Leveling has a fair tempo. The cost to play Arena (draft mode) can be a bit prohibitive. I would recommend new players spend their gold on packs.

There are 6 colors, 3 evil, 3 good. You have the option to buy small packs, normal packs or good/evil packs (which contain cards only from those specific colors) which short term could help you build a specific deck but again, I would personally recommend purchasing "normal packs" to diversify and fill out your collection.

For new players, I would personally recommend Corruption (black) to start with followed by Dominion. (purple) Corruption has a decent amount of aggro with soft removal and Dominion combines some hard removal with control. Once you unlock both, you can make a fairly decent black/purple deck to grind out the PVE content.

Crafting cards is level locked and the costs seem a bit on the high side compared to similar card games. Generally speaking, it seems more economical overall to buy packs versus crafting. Because of this, building that one specific deck (not even counting epics) that you really want might be a bit difficult.

There are also certain specific quests where you have to beat AI with an extremely ridiculous advantage where you can get a perfect first hand, play perfectly and still get roflstomped no matter what and it becomes apparent the only way to win is by using incredibly cheap combos that you will only be able to achieve by building up your collection.

New players should focus on the other available quests and unlocking new areas. After completing initial quests, daily quests are unlocked which offer varying rewards. Overall, the quest rewards are fairly generous though, the best being free packs. Most of the rewards are decent enough that the microtransactions don't feel forced.

Finding players can sometimes take longer than usual, leaving you to either wait...or just duke it out with the AI instead.

All that said, overall it's a solid, fairly fun game and with some minor improvements could really shine.

review:
Overall very happy with this game. It's an ambitious project that I think will be very attractive if they get around to implmenting the MMO Conquest mode (this isn't yet funded but is on their dev roadmap). The design and balance is well thoughtout, massively superior to most CCGs out there. I think I'd argue it has all the nuance of MtG. Over time I expect the themed expansions will add huge flexibility.

Pros:
+ Well designed combat mechanics
+ Broad range of early playstyles across the factions
+ Cool heroes who add unique flavor and flexibility to decks
+ The artwork and music are solid
+ AI scales well between modes

Mixed:
+/- You buy cards, some people will hate that. It isn't pay to win, you can craft every card in the game but that does require more time playing than some might want to spend
+/- I think balance between factions is good overall but needs some maturity
+/- Lore. It's not a must have but I think adding some flavor to get you more excited about your faction/cards would be cool

Cons:
- The game doesn't have any real social aspect or interactions unless you want to run IRC in a separate window. I'm fine with this so far but I might find it grows boring unless they're adding new content frequently enouogh
- Stability, this one is HUGE I don't know if these Dev's just lack experience building large redudant systems but drops and outages are frequent (and I'm playing on a dedicated 1 gig up/1 gig down link. Just improving their design would go a LONG way towards making this game a winner.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043343653', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 13325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1679, 'last_played': 1477811427}
review:
I'm a long time Magic the Gathering player, and ever since I discovered Spellweaver a little over four months ago it has become my favorite collectible card game. Spellweaver is a combination between Magic the Gathering, Hearthstone and Hex, but has a feel that is distinctly its own.

Pros:
+ You can attack individual creatures like in Hearthstone, and you can interact with the opponent on their turn with instant spells and effects like in Magic.
+ The speed system. Creatures have a speed stat that varies from 1 to 4, and can attack and intercept only creatures with a speed that is equal to or lower than their own speed. [b]All[/b] creatures can intercept other creatures, similarly to how Protectors could intercept other creatures in WoW TCG.
+ The two-row system. There's a front row and a support row. Creatures on the front row can attack but also be attacked, whereas creatures on the support row are safe from attacks but cannot attack. Flying creatures are the only ones that can attack from the support row.
+ The Divine Offering mechanic. With Divine Offering, once per turn, you can put a card from your hand on the bottom of the deck, look at the top five cards of the deck, put a resource card in your hand and the rest on the bottom.
+ The hero system. The game revolves around heroes, each having a unique skill like in Hex. Heroes can also acquire additional skills (up to three) with special resource cards.
+ The quest system, which is more generous than in any online card game I've played (maybe too generous). Quests have rarity just like cards (common, uncommon, rare and epic), with rarer ones giving better rewards, including packs and rare/epic cards.
+ The developers and the community. I like it that the developers are active on the game's forum and constantly engage with the community, and that they take advantage of the digital medium and constantly strive to improve and balance it.

(Actually there's more, but I seem to have reached the word limit.)

Cons:
- The number of cards is rather small at the moment.
- Some server issues. Hopefully they'll be fixed soon.
- The tutorial is not that great.
- You can only chat with people in your friends list.

The game is still in its infancy, but I think its long-term potential is huge. I highly recommend it.

Spellweaver is a very fun and enjoyable CCG. I've played other card games and this adds in some new features such as speed to make the experience that little more dynamic.

[*]Great system to avoid being mana starved.
[*]Nice Artwork.
[*]Good tutorial.
[*]Don't need to grind to have a good deck.
[*]Fast matchmaking.
[*]Tournaments with good prizes.

[b] Cons:[/b][list][*]Could do with more quests/PvE content.

[/list]
Overall I'd say it's a solid card game that will suck up most of your day. :)

review:
An amazing game by people who love TCGs and understand what is needed in a game like this. You don't need to spend a dime to enjoy every second of this game and it can appeal to both casual and hardcore gamers.

Give it a try, it's definitely worth it!

Pros:

-F2P and not at all P2W, you can throw in a few bucks if you really want to get cards very fast, but you really don't need to.
-Quest system gives you stuff to do other than spamming ranks or normal games and are VERY rewarding.

-Able to mix cards of different factions

author: {'steamid': '76561198173028159', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 12503, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2091, 'last_played': 1469267011}
review:
This game is great for those searching for an online CCG that's more complex and skill-based than Hearthstone. It also has many similarities to MTG, but offers a solid online experience that Magic lacks. For those familiar with MMDoC (Duel of Champions), which was a very good game but is basically dead now, this is probably the closest game in quality of design and complexity which hopefully will have a much longer lifespan.

Keep in mind that the game is still very new, so it has some of the common issues of newly emerging games - small-ish playerbase, small card pool, some stability problems (which are usually fixed quickly). But it shows a very good promise.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023484509', 'num_games_owned': 471, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 2893, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1878, 'last_played': 1471293225}
review:
Very interesting card game. As a long time MTG player, this is shaping up to be everything that Duels should have been! It's not in any way a direct clone of MTG, though it uses the same concepts as haste, first strike, lifelink, etc. But it also adds zones to the playfield, a speed attribute (which is very nice) on all creatures, new combat mechanics, as well as a more streamlined manabase (you'll still occasionally get manascrewed, but it is much much more fair, and less random).

Pros:
-Extremely fair f2p model. I'm actually worried if the devs can make money this way. Unfortunately, they purchases available seem pretty expensive, but since you don't need to buy anything at all to rather quickly collect a very sizeable set of cards, it's not an issue.
-Drafting already implemented
-tournaments running as well
-SO much designspace for expansions

Cons: 

-Few cards currently - It is a bit hard to make to monocolored decks of the same color that does not play sort of similar. It's obvious this is going to change though, so not a big issue.
-I can't find the chat that lets me talk to my opponent. I can chat with friends though.
-Lacks a proper tutorial

author: {'steamid': '76561198046944655', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 580, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 473, 'last_played': 1492934859}
review:
Alot better than the trash that's Hex: Shards of Fate, that's for sure. Thank God.

This is the first game in the digital space that makes me excited for the capability of online tcg/ccg's. I've played far more online card games than I care to admit, and this tops them all. The shrine system makes it so you never get mana screwed or mana flooded, and the artwork is industry leading imo. Hearthstone is too cartoony and Hex is just bad art. Honestly just a bad game in general. This game is slowly helping me remove the stench the other game left behind. 

Good job devs, wish you all the success as this game goes forward. I would like to see more animations when creatures attack and such, but this is a hugely quality product. Best card game on steam, and definitely the best on the market. You owe it to yourself to try it out. Fair warning though: if you're a Magic junkie like I was, it will take some getting used. The speed mechanic is confusing at first, but keep at it. It opens up an entirely new realm of strategic thought and possibility.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091455590', 'num_games_owned': 154, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1454718150}
review:
Joguei o BETA antes de vir para a Steam e só tenho boas coisas a falar do game, sou jogador de Magic (o fisico, não o online), e joguei um pouco de Hearthstone também. Spellweaver tem a velocidade de HS com a profundidade e arte de Magic, é ótimo.

Quem ja jogou card games online sabe como é dificil conseguir cartas sem usar cash shop, Spellweaver vai na contra-mão dando cards a torto e a direito por qualquer coisa que vc faz no game.

A arte é belíssima, realmente incrivel!
As habilidades e peculiaridades de cada carta, como velocidade por exemplo, fazem com que vc precise efetivamente usar o cérebro, sem que isso deixe o game lento ou monótono.

Se você curte card games, estrategia, ou simplesmente quer algo para passar o tempo com qualidade esse jogo vai suprir suas necessidades.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972711006', 'num_games_owned': 94, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3834, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1536005582}
review:
If you like CCG, you should definitely give a try with Spellweaver, you’ll love it.

I’ve played it for around 6 month now in beta. 

Let’s start straight with the cons:
Manascrew : Spellweaver uses a mana system close to magic’s one. They have a system, divine offering, which greatly reduces the chances to not have a land next turn by replacing a cards. Yet it happens (around 10%). If you play modern CCG, you won’t get use to miss mana sometime, and it can be frustrating.
About the server crash at launch: this is a misfortune many games could encounter (who said diablo 3?) and you should not base your opinion on it. The server has run smoothly last few months.

What else? Nothing else! That’s why this game is amazing! Everything is interesting and well thought. The devs themselves are experienced players and you can see it in every choice they make. Here is some cool stuff you will find in Spellweaver:
•	Probably the most generous F2P system I’ve found among all the cards game I’ve played.
•	The speed system. Every creature has a new stat: speed. Long story short, this system avoid stuck situation where nobody wants to attacks.
•	You can play only two times during opponent’s turn. During combat phase and at the end of his turn. Just enough to play some tricks that can change the tide of a battle. But not too much to avoid slow games where you have to ask your opponent for every single move you make.
•	You’ve a hero with a power. And he can learns up to two new skills which could lead to really interesting strategies.
•	NO RNG in the cards abilities.
•	Support lane. Trial, Draft mode (incoming). Conquest mode (incoming). Aspects (which allow multi colors decks).Lifewin condition. Etc…

I could go long for all the stuff that I like in this game. Every single thing adds so much depth to the game play. Since Duel of champions, this is the game I enjoyed the most and if you liked DoC you’ll love SW. To conclude, this game may be young and of course needs to improve on some points. But overall, this is the one that has the most potential among every cards game I tried and you should definitely give a look.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048184956', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3491, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1475, 'last_played': 1471725302}
review:
An excellent digital CCG so far.  It uses a mechanical template more similar to Magic than to Hearthstone, but even then it has made some major mechanical changes, and does not feel like a bad clone.  As a long term cardboard CCG player (primarily the extremely complex and deep Legend of the Five Rings), I'm glad to see a game that isn't emulating Hearthstone (which was too simplistic mechanically for me).  

Mechanical Differences with Magic:

Dual Resource Management - The basic resource generator can either be played to increase your mana or to increase your strength in that school of magic, allowing access to stronger cards.  Knowing when to do which is an important thing to figure out.

Resource Cantrip - Basic resources replace themselves which really helps the pacing of the game.

Resource Tutoring - There is a built in mechanic to prevent resource screw - you can discard a card to search the top of your deck for a resource.

Speed Mechanics - An interesting tweak to add other facets to the attack and block matchup.  Units can't block units that are faster than them allowing for some interesting tactical matchups.

Support Line - Allows interesting non combat abilities to be relatively safe during run of the mill combat, and creates a more interesting flying mechanic than just being unblockable (which is its down rare mechanic).  


There are lots of other little differences of course, but many are lexical changes (terms that have been renamed).  All in all, it's a fun game with lots of potential.  It's worth at least checking out.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963655457', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 3876, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3244, 'last_played': 1455343211}
review:
For the most part this is a good design concept game.  However, I have to say I cannot recommend this game while there are so many egregious bugs.

[list]
[*]Random disconnects
[*]If the opposing player takes forever on their turn, the game thinks you are idle and you have to click the "continue playing" button in five seconds or it skips your next action / turn.
[*]The "continue playing" button animates when you click it, but the action almost never registers
[*]If the opposing player disconnects from the game, you can auto win after three minutes by clicking "stop waiting".  However, you cannot dismiss the dialog, and your play timer continues winding down.  You can play cards from your hand but can't do anything with the cards on the board except click the "all attack" button.  So if your play timer is less than three minutes, and your opponent disconnects, you lose.
[*]Multiple times in Trial (draft) online matches, without clicking or performing any action, your turn and/or option to block will just be randomly skipped.
[*]Some card mechanic behaviors are not clearly identified on the card.
[/list]

10/10 would hire a quality engineer again

author: {'steamid': '76561197982893207', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 156, 'playtime_forever': 963, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1542672645}
review:
One of the best if not the best card game on steam, in my opinion.

Varied themes: elves, undead, wizards etc. all have unique mechanics and feel really different when playing, or when playing against.

Seem to be fine to progress in without spending money as well.

Rules are not explained too well though (especially the nuances of blocking), and some rules have to be experienced before you know how they should be interpreted (there's a card that says that as soon as it's destroyed its twin is destroyed as well, but it turns out that this is after the combat phase, not during the combat phase).
But all in all, that's only when you dive pretty far into it and I don't really mind, just thought I'd mention it.

Card art is nice. 

I like the pace and flow of the game, with how your casting cost increase works.

The two fields for your creatures and the mechanics that stem from that are nice as well.

So, apart from a little issue with the tutorial this is really nice.
Looking forward to the announced coming expansions :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198032565498', 'num_games_owned': 287, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1456252552}
review:
Note: I've played for several months on the non-Steam client.

Pros:

+The core gameplay is very good, there are many mechanics that are similar to MtG

+There's a system in place to prevent getting "land screwed"; once a turn you can return 1 card in your hand to your deck, look at the top 5 cards of your deck, and take 1 shrine card from them(shrines=lands, more or less)

+Very little RNG(if you got cancer from Boom Bots doing 4 damage every time, you might enjoy this game)

+Nice artwork

+Actual strategy/tactics; the depth of what kinds of decks you can make is enormous since you can mix cards from different factions/aspects

+Fairly good f2p model. Winning games against  people doesn't give you that much gold, but the quests you get often will. They range from pretty crappy(do X and get 1500 gold) to insanely valuable(play X games and get 20 packs)

+You can disenchant cards you don't want and craft ones you do. Similar to Hearthstone's system.

Cons:

-Servers are unstable(As of Feb 9, 2016 the servers are much more stable, I haven't been d/ced in several days)

-Relatively steep learning curve(I've seen a number of negative reviews where someone was complaining about a mechanic that they clearly did not understand)

-Related to the previous point, there could me more clarity in explaining certain mechanics, such as speed(hover over a card if you're uncertain what it does, there will be a description and a tooltip that explains mechanics associated with the card, like freeze or shock)

-Small(ish) playerbase, you can run into the same person a lot when you're playing friendly/casual matches

Important issues/questions:

Is the game pay to win?????? 

Not really. It's more like pay to convenience. If you drop 100 bucks on the game, you will be able to get a fuckload of cards, which will allow you to make a wide variety of decks. However, you don't need to put money into the game to win. Even the Corruption starter deck can take games off of high-tier expensive decks. I personally have been playing for like 2.5 months and I have almost all the cards. I did spend 20 dollars though. However, if you want to be completely f2p, I recommend doing a decent amount of research to find decks you enjoy that are also cheap. I would say that Spellweaver's f2p model is more generous than Hearthstone's, as a point of comparison.

What are the "classes" in this game?

-Wisdom: Weird faction, their whole thing is energy/robots/technology. Generally play more midrangey or aggro.

-Nature: Quick units(elves) that like hitting your face, very few big threats.

-Order: Healing and buffing, usually a midrangey style but they also have some of the biggest minions in the game(which can enable them to play controlly).

-Rage: Aggressive SMOrc class with lots of burn. They can also play the midrange game.

-Dominion: Control incarnate. Quite expensive though, wouldn't recommend starting with Dominion.

-Corruption: Evil/undead units that are generally very, very slow. They play aggressively.

How should I spend my gold?

Buy the 10 card packs that cost 12.5k gold each. Once you're familiar with the game, do trials(basically Arena from Hearthstone). Probably best to avoid trials until you're decently experienced.

What if I don't want to play against people with full decks? Can I still do quests? 

Yeah, almost all of the quests can be done against AI opponents.

ADVICE:

Pick corruption for your starting deck. Just do it. It's super easy to play and is probably the strongest starter deck. You could also pick Wisdom and make a tempo wisdom deck(google it), which can be very strong. It's a bit difficult to play though. 

As soon as you're able, change the number of shrines in your deck to 20. The starter decks have 23, which is too many.

Google something like "spellweaver free gold". MMObomb has a promotion where they're giving away keys that give you 100k gold in Spellweaver. This is worth about 15 bucks. As of right now, I think there are like 26k keys left. If you don't wanna make an account on mmobomb to get the key, just google what I mentioned earlier. People seem to be posting keys in random ass places(I got mine from some random website called whosgamingnow or something). Obviously, there could be some sketchy sites that come up in the search so be careful. If you do this and the tutorial, you get 125k gold, which will buy you 10 packs(each pack has 10 cards and is guaranteed 1 rare card or more).

If you want to include skill shrines into your deck(essentially lands that give your hero a skill), put in 3 at most. 4 is almost always overkill and you'll find yourself with it being dead in your hand often.

If you care about graphics/polish over gameplay, then you should not play this game. It does not have anywhere near the level of polish that Hearthstone does.

If you don't like complex games, stay away from this one. The depth of strategy and execution is far greater than that of Hearthstone. If you're someone who enjoys MtG, you'll probably enjoy Spellweaver. If you're someone who likes games simple/casual and easy to jump into, you probably will not like Spellweaver.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989034443', 'num_games_owned': 183, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 352, 'last_played': 1595650083}
review:
Summary: Fun game but plagued with serious server instability. 

Pros: MTG feel with a lot of hearthstone thrown in. Trials are very similar to the Forge. The major advancement that was made was to their mana/land system. All lands either allow you to draw a card or give you an additional hero power you can use in addition to the mana. Theres also an ability that allows you to discard a card to fish for a land in the top 5 cards of your deck at no cost. Mana problems really don't exist. While it does have a p2w model, the f2p model is well designed. You aren't gated with energy or the like. Wins against the AI grant around 200-300 gold while packs cost 12k. You also get additional gold and cards from daily quests you can unlock. 

Cons: In addition to the serious server issues (dc's, major lag, etc). The rules can be a bit rough to learn as the tutorial doesn't go in depth to the different mechanics involved with blocking. MTG players can also get a little off guard with abilities such as flying which prevents you from being attacked but does not offer evasion. The only serious complaint I have is their servers.
